factionarius: <entryFree id="n17522" type="main" key="facti^o_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">factĭōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>factio, II. B. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n17522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the head of a company of charioteers</hi>, Cod. Th. 15, 10, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 338</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
factiose: <entryFree id="n17523" type="main" key="facti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">factĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. factiosus <sense id="n17523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
factiosus: <entryFree id="n17524" type="main" key="facti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">factĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>factio, II.</etym>, <sense id="n17524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seeks to form a party</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eager for power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">factious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seditious</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: perduellis, seditiosus, tumultuosus, turbulentus, potens, praepotens): homo dives, factiosus,</quote> <trans><tr>a demagogue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potens et factiosus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 26, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo (with potens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsistunt in re publica plerumque largitores et factiosi, ut opes quam maximas consequantur, et sint vi potius superiores quam justitia pares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non divitiis cum divite, neque factione cum factioso, certabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 54, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 31, 15</bibl> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">vel optimatium vel factiosa tyrannis illa vel regia, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>oligarchical</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:29:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 29, 45</bibl></cit>: linguă factiosi, <hi rend="ital">busy with the tongue</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">promising a great deal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 21" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 5</bibl></cit>. —* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">factĭōse</orth>, <hi rend="ital">mightily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerfully</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 24</bibl>. <cb n="FACU" /></sense></entryFree>
factitamenta: <entryFree id="n17525" type="main" key="facti^ta_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">factĭtāmenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>factito</etym>, <sense id="n17525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">things made</hi>, <hi rend="ital">works</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
factitatio: <entryFree id="n17526" type="main" key="facti^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">factĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creating</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
factitator: <entryFree id="n17527" type="main" key="facti^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">factĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">idolorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 18 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
factitius: <entryFree id="n17528" type="main" key="facti_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">factītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. facticius.</entryFree>
factito: <entryFree id="n17529" type="main" key="facti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">factĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>facto</etym>, <sense id="n17529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">do frequently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be wont to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to practise</hi> (class.; syn.: tracto, facio, reddo). </sense><sense id="n17529.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitia'st, me illi vitio vortere. Egomet quod factitavi in adolescentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba compone et quasi coagmenta, quod ne Graeci quidem veteres factitaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 17, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec apud majores nostros factitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 24, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum factitatum est, alterum novum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:42:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 42, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 34, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eorum quicquam omittere quae artifices factitarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra ex ea arbore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 9, 17, § 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">capulos inde (ex gemma),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 6, 23, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inducias cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:5:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17529.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17529.3" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">double acc.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">declare</hi> a person something: <cit><quote lang="la">quem palam heredem semper factitarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17529.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To practise</hi> a trade or profession: artem, Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:43:147" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 43, 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coactiones argentarias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vecturas onerum corpore suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17529.5" n="C" level="2"> Esp. with access. notion of vain effort or failure: <cit><quote lang="la">nec satis apparet cur versus factitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina in principem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 45</bibl></cit> (39); 14, 48.</sense></entryFree>
facto: <entryFree id="n17530" type="spur" key="facto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">facto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>facio</etym>, <sense id="n17530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis quicquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; false reading for facio; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 95</bibl> Ritschl.</sense></entryFree>
factor: <entryFree id="n17531" type="main" key="factor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">factor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">performer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetrator</hi> (ante- and postclass.). </sense><sense id="n17531.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cuparum doliorumque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui praepositum suum non praetexit, cum posset, in pari causa factori habendus est,</quote> <trans><tr>the doer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:6:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 6, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:1:section=21" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 29, 5, 1, § 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:3:7" default="NO">48, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suus,</quote> <trans><tr>his creator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:32:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 32, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:29:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 29, 16 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis,</quote> <trans><tr>doer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 2, 13</bibl></cit>; id. Jacob, 1, 23.—</sense><sense id="n17531.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17531.3" n="A" level="2"> In econom. lang., <hi rend="ital">an oil-presser</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">66</bibl>; 67.—* </sense><sense id="n17531.4" n="B" level="2"> In ball-playing, <hi rend="ital">he who strikes the ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the batsman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 18</bibl>; cf. dator.</sense></entryFree>
factorium: <entryFree id="n17532" type="hapax" key="facto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">factōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.; cf. factor, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n17532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an oil-press</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
factum: <entryFree id="n17533" type="main" key="factum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">factum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n17533.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref targOrder="U">facio</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
factura: <entryFree id="n17534" type="main" key="factu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">factūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>facio</etym>, <sense id="n17534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manufacture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formation</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">poi/hsis</foreign> (post-Aug. and very rare). </sense><sense id="n17534.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">in nostro orbe aliubi vena bonitatem hanc praestat, aliubi factura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis totius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:29:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 8, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17534.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a thing produced</hi> or <hi rend="ital">created</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a creature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">work</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima factura dei est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 792</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 856</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
factus: <entryFree id="n17535" type="main" key="factus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">factus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from facio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17536" type="main" key="factus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">factus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">factum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 19</bibl> and 22) [facio]. * <sense id="n17536.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A making</hi>, <hi rend="ital">building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">style of architecture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ornatior villa esse posset fructu quam factu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste mulus me ad factum dabit (= me ad opus rusticum feret),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Momms.</author> 5078</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17536.1" n="II" level="1"> (Cf. factor, II. A., and factorium), <hi rend="ital">the quantity of oil pressed out at one time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pressing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 67, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:22" default="NO">22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 6, 6, § 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
facul: <entryFree id="n17537" type="main" key="fa^cul"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcul</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. facilis <sense id="n17537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
facula: <entryFree id="n17538" type="main" key="fa^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>fax</etym>, <sense id="n17538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little torch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a splinter used as a torch</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=137" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 137</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:29:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 29, 5</bibl> (3, 27, 5 M.); Cinc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4, 2</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n17538.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequidquam tibi Fortuna faculam adlucere volt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 8, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
facultas: <entryFree id="n17539" type="main" key="fa^cultas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcultas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (<sense id="n17539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:29 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 9, 29 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:78:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 78, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 8</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>facul, facilis; cf.: difficultas, simultas</etym>, <hi rend="ital">capability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportunity; skill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ability</hi> to do any thing easily (class.; syn.: dotes, virtutes, <pb n="719" /> <cb n="FACU" /> ingenium, indoles). </sense><sense id="n17539.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultates sunt, aut quibus facilius fit, aut sine quibus aliquid confici non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:27:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 27, 41</bibl></cit>.—Constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17539.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of <hi rend="ital">gerund.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultas pariendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa copia facultasque dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi facultatem dicendi parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Miloni manendi nulla facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:17:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 17, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipiendi maleficii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:33:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 33, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laedendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redimendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultatem judicandi facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:73:section=179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 73, § 179</bibl></cit> et saep.—So with ellipsis of dicendi: <cit><quote lang="la">extemporalis facultas,</quote> <trans><tr>of extemporaneous speaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 84</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facultas summa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 29, 5</bibl>.—With a <hi rend="ital">gen. subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">talium sumptuum facultatem fructum divitiarum putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod reliquis fugae facultas daretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demostheni facultatem defuisse hujus rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: si facultas tui praesentis esset, <hi rend="ital">if I could but meet you face to face</hi>, Planc. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultates medicamentorum,</quote> <trans><tr>virtue</tr>, <tr>efficacy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17539.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne irato facultas ad dicendum data esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 10, 22</bibl></cit> (6, 12); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad explicandas tuas litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ducendum bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38, 4</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii facultates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae mihi ad satis faciendum reliquo tempore facultates dabuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si facultas sit alendis sarmentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17539.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modica in dicendo facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17539.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnumquam improbo facultas dari, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:25:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 25, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Quintius oblatam sibi facultatem putavit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 28, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erit haec facultas in eo, quem volumus esse eloquentem, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:33:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 33, 117</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nobis saevire facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:513" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 513</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 16</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 78.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave quicquam, quod ad meum commodum attineat, nisi maximo tuo commodo et maxima tua facultate cogitaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urges istam occasionem et facultatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtica quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultas ex ceteris rebus comparata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si facultas erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Inv. 1, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc abite, dum est facultas,</quote> <trans><tr>while you can</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad facultas feret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n17539.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., for copia, opes, <hi rend="ital">a sufficient</hi> or <hi rend="ital">great number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plenty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">store;</hi> plur., <hi rend="ital">goods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">riches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">property</hi> (syn.: opes, bona, silva, divitiae, fortunae, copia, vis). </sense><sense id="n17539.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummorum facultas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus generis (virorum) erat in senatu facultas maxima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultas vacui ac liberi temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 15, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum, quae ad bellum usui erant, summa erat in eo oppido facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si facultas ejus succi sit copiosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:8 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 38, 8 al.</bibl></cit>: pro facultate quisque, <hi rend="ital">in proportion to his ability</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wealth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17539.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anquirunt ad facultates rerum atque copias, ad potentiam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutandis facultatibus et commodis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultates commodorum praetermittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me tuae facultates sustinent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videndum ne major benignitas sit quam facultates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultates ad largiendum magnas comparasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultates patrimonii nostri aliis relinquemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">16: Gaius attritis facultatibus urbe cessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modicus facultatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 32, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tantas videri Italiae facultates, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>supplies</tr>, <tr>resources</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 49, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministrare alicui de facultatibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui facultates suas suspectas habet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>doubts his own solvency</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:154" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 154</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
facultatula: <entryFree id="n17540" type="main" key="fa^culta_tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcultātŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>facultas, II.</etym>, <sense id="n17540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">small</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scanty means</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pro facultatula sua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 45" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 45 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
faculter: <entryFree id="n17541" type="main" key="fa^culter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făculter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. facilis <sense id="n17541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 3.</sense></entryFree>
facunde: <entryFree id="n17542" type="main" key="fa_cunde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fācundē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n17542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eloquently</hi>, v. facundus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
facundia: <entryFree id="n17543" type="main" key="fa_cundi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fācundĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>facundus</etym>, <sense id="n17543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eloquence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluency</hi> (like facundus, not freq. till after <cb n="FAEN" /> the Aug. period; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic., Caes., or Liv.): hic actor tantum poterit a facundia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facundia Graecos, gloria belli Gallos ante Romanos fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 53, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Graeca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 63:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 63, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeca Latinaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 117</bibl>: alere facundiam, Quint. prooem. § 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:1:3" default="NO">8, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:80" default="NO">10, 1, 80</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:13:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 13, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:5:1" default="NO">18, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:7 al" default="NO">19, 9, 7 al.</bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:17:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 17, 1</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a person, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:69" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
facundiosus: <entryFree id="n17544" type="hapax" key="fa_cundi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fācundĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>facundia</etym>, <sense id="n17544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of eloquence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eloquent</hi>, Sempr. Asellio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
facunditas: <entryFree id="n17545" type="main" key="fa_cundi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fācundĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>facundus</etym>, <sense id="n17545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eloquence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
facundus: <entryFree id="n17546" type="main" key="fa_cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fācundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fari</etym>, <sense id="n17546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that speaks with ease</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fluency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eloquent</hi> (syn.: disertus, eloquens; <cit><quote lang="la">loquax, dicax): qui facile fantur, facundi dicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 52</bibl></cit> Müll. (not freq. till after the Aug. period; not in Cic. or Caes.; cf. facundia). </sense><sense id="n17546.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">satis facundu's: sed jam fieri dictis compendium volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: suavis homo, facundus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 250 ed. Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 95, 3</bibl>: loquax magis quam facundus, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 2, 2</bibl>; and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mercuri, facunde nepos Atlantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ulixes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facundum faciebat amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:469" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rufus, vir facundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facundus et promptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 53</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnibus gentibus alius alio facundior habetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 44</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facundissimus quisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17546.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ingenia humana sunt ad suam cuique levandam culpam nimio plus facunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (al. fecunda): <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ōs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:698" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 698</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:245" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 245</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:274" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 274</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facunda et composita oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:43:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 43, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqua comoedia facundissimae libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 65</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fācunde</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with eloquence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eloquently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis facete nimisque facunde mala es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis facunde loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequi aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseratur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 39</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">describere locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusare vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:8:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fadius: <entryFree id="n17547" type="main" key="Fadi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fadĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n17547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:55 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 55 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
faecarius: <entryFree id="n17548" type="hapax" key="faeca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faecārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>faex</etym>, <sense id="n17548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for the dregs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lees</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sportae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
faecatus: <entryFree id="n17549" type="hapax" key="faeca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faecātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made from the dregs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lees</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>pressed from the dregs</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 153</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 10, 12, § 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faeceus: <entryFree id="n17550" type="hapax" key="faece^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faecĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feculent;</hi> only flg.: <cit><quote lang="la">nil ego istos moror faeceos mores, turbidos, quibus boni dedecorant sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
faecinius: <entryFree id="n17551" type="main" key="faeci^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faecĭnĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">faecĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that makes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leaves dregs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in dregs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 47, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
faecosus: <entryFree id="n17552" type="main" key="faeco_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faecōsus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of dregs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">garum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:102:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 102, 2</bibl></cit> dub. (al. fastosum).</sense></entryFree>
faecula: <entryFree id="n17553" type="main" key="faecu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faecŭla</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">fēcŭla</orth>, and contracted <orth extent="full" lang="la">faecla</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">burnt tartar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">salt of tartar</hi>, deposited in the form of a crust by wine (used as a condiment or as a drug), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 430</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 226 al" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 226 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
faeculentia: <entryFree id="n17554" type="main" key="faecu^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faecŭlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>faeculentus</etym>, <sense id="n17554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dregs; filth</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n17554.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17554.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Const. Verg. p. 156</bibl></cit> Munk.</sense></entryFree>
faeculentus: <entryFree id="n17555" type="main" key="faecu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faecŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>faex</etym>, <sense id="n17555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in dregs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sediment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feculent</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n17555.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sardonyches,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 23, § 89</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">superficies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum aliud faeculentissimum redditur terrae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>excrement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Vera Relig. 40" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Vera Relig. 40</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17555.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilaritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
faenarius: <entryFree id="n17556" type="main" key="faena_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenārĭus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>faenum</etym>, <sense id="n17556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for hay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hay-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">falces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:31:38" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 31, 38</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">faenārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a seller</hi> <cb n="FAEN" /> <hi rend="ital">of hay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hay salesman</hi>, Inscr. ap. Grut. 175, 9.</sense></entryFree>
faenebris: <entryFree id="n17557" type="main" key="faene_^bris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenē^bris</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>faenus; cf. Paul. ex Fest. pp. 86 and 94</etym>, <sense id="n17557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to interest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">usury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <trans><tr>the matter of interest and debts</tr>, <tr>the relations between debtor and creditor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <trans><tr>lent on interest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> 6, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
faenerarius: <entryFree id="n17558" type="main" key="faene^ra_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, for the usual faenerator, <sense id="n17558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who lends money on interest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a usurer</hi>, Firm. 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17558.1" type="gloss" key="faene^ra_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĕrārĭus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>faenum</etym>, = faenarius, <hi rend="ital">a seller of hay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hay salesman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">macellarios, vinarios, faenerarios, et cellaritas sic servari desideramus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 10, 28 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></entryFree>
faeneraticius: <entryFree id="n17559" type="main" key="faene^ra_ti^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĕrātĭcĭus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tius</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>faeneror</etym>, <sense id="n17559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to interest</hi> (law Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cautio, instrumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 30, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
faeneratio: <entryFree id="n17560" type="main" key="faene^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĕrātĭo</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lending on interest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usury</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec pecunia tota ab honoribus translata est in quaestum et faenerationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 23, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim, si tuam ob causam cuiquam commodes, beneficium illud habendum est, sed faeneratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:72:section=168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 72, § 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1 praef.</bibl> § 8.</sense></entryFree>
faenerato: <entryFree id="n17561" type="main" key="faene^ra_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĕrāto</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>faeneratus</etym>, <sense id="n17561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with interest</hi> (Plautinian): <cit><quote lang="la">nae illam mecastor faenerato abstulisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nae ille ecastor faenerato funditat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
faenerator: <entryFree id="n17562" type="main" key="faene^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĕrātor</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>faeneror</etym>, <sense id="n17562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who lends on interest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a money-lender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capitalist;</hi> with an odious secondary idea, <hi rend="ital">a usurer</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">improbantur ii quaestus, qui in odia hominum incurrunt, ut portitorum, ut faeneratorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>; Cato, R. R. praef. § 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:67" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
faeneratorius: <entryFree id="n17563" type="main" key="faene^ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĕrātōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>faenerator</etym>, <sense id="n17563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a usurer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usurious</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faeneratrix: <entryFree id="n17564" type="main" key="faene^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĕrātrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>faeneror</etym>, <sense id="n17564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female money-lender</hi> or <hi rend="ital">usurer</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:2:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faeneratus: <entryFree id="n17565" type="main" key="faene^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from faeneror.</entryFree>
faenero: <entryFree id="n17566" type="main" key="faenero"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenero</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, v. faeneror.</entryFree>
faeneror: <entryFree id="n17567" type="main" key="faene^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĕror</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>ātus sum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, or (mostly post-Aug.), <orth extent="full" lang="la">faenero</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>faenus</etym>. <sense id="n17567.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to lend on interest.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17567.1" n="A" level="2"> Form faeneror. </sense><sense id="n17567.2" n="1" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias istius extraordinarias grandes suo nomine faenerabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:70:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 170</bibl></cit>: primum cum posita esset pecunia apud eas societates, binis centesimis faeneratus est, <hi rend="ital">took two per cent.</hi> (per month, and consequently, according to our reckoning, twenty-four per cent. per annum), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 70</bibl>, § 165.—</sense><sense id="n17567.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo (Catone) cum quaereretur, quid maxime in re familiari expediret? respondit: Bene pascere ... Et cum ille, qui quaesierat, dixisset: Quid faenerari? tum Cato: Quid hominem occidere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:25:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 25, 89</bibl></cit>; cf. Cato, R. R. praef. § 1.—</sense><sense id="n17567.4" n="B" level="2"> Form faenero. </sense><sense id="n17567.5" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">sub</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam publicam sub usuris solitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17567.6" n="2" level="3"> In <hi rend="ital">simple constr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam pupillarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:46:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 46, § 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17567.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Without object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil debet: faenerat immo magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:86:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 86, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17567.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia faenerata a tutoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:100" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pseudo</author> Ascon. ad Cic. Div. in Caecil. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17567.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17567.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To drain by usury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimissiones libertorum ad faenerandas diripiendasque provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:2:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 2, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17567.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To borrow on interest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis pecuniam dominicam a servo faeneratus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17567.12" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sol suum lumen ceteris quoque sideribus faenerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 6, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummos habet arca Minervae: haec sapit, haec omnes faenerat una deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:77:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 77, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17567.13" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17567.14" n="A" level="2"> Neque enim beneficium faeneramur, <hi rend="ital">practise usury with benefits</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">faeneratum istuc beneficium tibi pulchre dices,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>richly repaid</tr>, <tr>rewarded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 11</bibl> Ruhnk.—</sense><sense id="n17567.15" n="B" level="2"> Juba et Petreius mutuis <pb n="720" /> <cb n="FAEN" /> vulneribus concurrerunt et mortes faeneraverunt, <hi rend="ital">exchanged with usury</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">inflicted on each other</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faeneus: <entryFree id="n17568" type="main" key="faene^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>faenum, I.</etym>, <sense id="n17568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of hay</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">homines faeneos in medium ad tentandum periculum projectos,</quote> <trans><tr>men of hay</tr>, <tr>hay effigies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:Or. Cornel. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fragm. Or. Cornel. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra effigie hominum ex faeno fieri solebant, quibus objectis ad spectaculum praebendum tauri irritarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:page=62" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> p. 62</bibl></cit> ed. Orell.— </sense><sense id="n17568.1" n="II" level="1"> Fig.: faeneus ille Platonicus Antiochus, August. c. Acad. 3, 18.</sense></entryFree>
faeniculum: <entryFree id="n17569" type="main" key="faeni^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĭcŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>faenum, II.</etym>, <sense id="n17569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fennel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 95, § 254</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faenilia: <entryFree id="n17570" type="main" key="faeni_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenīlĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>faenum, I.</etym>, <sense id="n17570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hay-loft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec totā claudes faenilia brumā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 321</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 67, § 258</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 457</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faenilis: <entryFree id="n17571" type="gloss" key="faenilis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenilis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = fenebris, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 68</bibl>.</entryFree>
faeniseca: <entryFree id="n17572" type="main" key="faeni^se^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĭsĕca</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, v. faenisex.</entryFree>
faenisecta: <entryFree id="n17573" type="main" key="faeni^secta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĭ-secta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>faenum, I.; seco</etym>, <sense id="n17573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mown hay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=136" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 136</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. faenisicia.</sense></entryFree>
faenisector: <entryFree id="n17574" type="main" key="faeni^sector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĭ-sector</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grass-cutter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mower</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 12</bibl>; cf. faenisex.</sense></entryFree>
faenisex: <entryFree id="n17575" type="main" key="faeni^sex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĭ-sex</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>ĕcis</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĭ-sĕca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:40" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 40</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n17575.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a mower</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:49:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 49, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:17:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 17, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">igitur cornu propter oleum ad crus ligato faenisex incedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 67, § 261</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17575.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">countryman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:40" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faenisicia: <entryFree id="n17576" type="main" key="faeni^si^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenĭ-sĭcĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mown hay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">addere faenisiciae cumulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:49:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 49, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:47" default="NO">1, 47</bibl> and 56: <cit><quote lang="la">vindemias ac faenisicia administrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:17:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; 2, 11, 7; 3, 2, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:17:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 17, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faenum: <entryFree id="n17577" type="main" key="faenum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenum</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">fēn-</orth>, not <orth extent="full" lang="la">foen-</orth>), i. <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fe-, feo; whence felix, femina, etc., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=86" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 86</bibl></etym>. <sense id="n17577.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:258 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 67, § 258 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 645</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judaei, quorum cophinus faenumque supellex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:18" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:542" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 542</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">faenum alios aiebat esse oportere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>seemed as stupid as oxen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:57:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 57, 233</bibl></cit>: faenum habet in cornu, i. e. <hi rend="ital">he is a dangerous fellow</hi> (the figure being taken from an ox apt to gore, whose horns were bound about with hay), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17577.1" n="II" level="1"> Faenum (fen-) Graecum, also as one word, faenumgraecum, <hi rend="ital">fenugreek</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 27, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:33" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 39, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faenus: <entryFree id="n17578" type="main" key="faenus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">fēn-</orth>, not <orth extent="full" lang="la">foen-</orth>; cf. in the foll.), <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fe-, feo; cf.: faenum, femina, etc.; therefore, lit., what is produced; hence</etym>. <sense id="n17578.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">the proceeds of capital lent out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interest</hi> (cf.: usura, versura): faenerator, sicuti M. Varro in libro tertio de Sermone Latino scripsit, a faenore est nominatus. Faenus autem dictum a fetu, et quasi a fetura quadam pecuniae parientis atque increscentis, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:12:7 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 12, 7 sq.</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 54, 5 sq.</bibl>; cf.: faenus et faeneratores et lex de credita pecunia fenebris a fetu dicta, quod crediti nummi alios pariant, ut apud Graecos eadem res <foreign lang="greek">to/kos</foreign> dicitur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=86" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 86</bibl> Müll.: cf.: faenum (so it should read, instead of faenus) appellatur naturalis terrae fetus; <cit><quote lang="la">ob quam causam et nummorum fetus faenus est vocatum et de ea re leges fenebres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem pecunias his faenori dabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:70:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam faenore accipere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 72</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">169: Scaptius centesimis, renovato in singulos annos faenore, contentus non fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faenus ex triente Idib. Quint. factum erat bessibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquissimo faenore versuram facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci solvent tolerabili faenore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam occupare grandi faenore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 21, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dives positis in faenore nummis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 421</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">faenore omni solutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17578.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17578.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Capital lent on interest</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">argenti faenus creditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faenus et impendium recusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17578.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that lent to the soil</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the seed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam bona fide terra creditum faenus reddit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 63, 63, § 155</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17578.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantage</hi>: terra, <cb n="FALA" /> quae nunquam recusat imperium, nec unquam sine usura reddit quod accepit, sed alias minore, plerumque majore cum faenore, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 51</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">semina, quae magno faenore reddat ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 22</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quinquagesimo faenore messes reddit eximia fertilitas soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 47, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe venit magno faenore tardus amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:26" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">at mihi, quod vivo detraxerit invida turba, Post obitum duplici faenore reddet Honos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 1, 22.</sense></entryFree>
faenusculum: <entryFree id="n17579" type="hapax" key="faenuscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faenuscŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fēn-, foen-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>faenus</etym>, <sense id="n17579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little interest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faesulae: <entryFree id="n17580" type="main" key="Faesu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Faesŭlae</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fēs-</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n17580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Fiesole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 24, 2</bibl>.—Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Faesŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:479" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 479</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17580.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv., <orth extent="full" lang="la">Faesŭlānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Fēs-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Faesulae</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Faesulan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 24, 49</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Faesŭlā-nus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Faesulan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faex: <entryFree id="n17581" type="main" key="faex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faex</orth>, <itype>faecis</itype> (<sense id="n17581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi>: faecum, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 114</bibl> P.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">grounds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sediment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dregs</hi> of liquids (cf. sentina). </sense><sense id="n17581.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis mundi quasi limus subsedit funditus ut faex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poti faece tenus cadi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 15, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peruncti faecibus ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aceti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 16, 62, § 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 2, 33, § 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:23:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 23, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17581.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17581.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Burnt tartar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">salt of tartar</hi> (cf. faecula), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 55</bibl> and 73.—</sense><sense id="n17581.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The brine of pickles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 666</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17581.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sediment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dregs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impurities</hi> of other things: <cit><quote lang="la">salis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 42, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 13, 37, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbosissima stibii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 6, 34, § 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17581.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Paint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wash for the face</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 211</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17581.7" n="5" level="3"> Jestingly, <hi rend="ital">the last remains</hi> of one's money: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid adhuc superest de nostri faece locelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:13:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17581.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">res itaque ad summam faecem turbasque residit,</quote> <trans><tr>to the lowest dregs of the people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quota portio faecis Achaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:61" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">apud illam perditissimam atque infimam faecem populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud sordem urbis et faecem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: in Romuli faece,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:39:section=99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 39, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de faece hauris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from bad orators</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:244" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 69, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faeces Israël,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:49:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 49, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies sine faece,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unclouded</tr>, <tr>clear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:14:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 14, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fageus: <entryFree id="n17582" type="main" key="fa_ge^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāgĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fagus</etym>, <sense id="n17582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of beech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beechen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">glans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 5, 6, § 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 6, 8, § 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 10, 15, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 44, 91, § 242</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fagineus: <entryFree id="n17583" type="main" key="fa_gi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāgĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of beech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beechen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <trans><tr>beech-wood</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 654</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
