faginus: <entryFree id="n17584" type="main" key="fa_gi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāgĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of beech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beechen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17584.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:656" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:45:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 45, 5</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17584.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fāgĭ-nus</orth>, <itype>for fagus</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a beech-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:2:59" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 2, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fagus: <entryFree id="n17585" type="greek" key="fa_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n17585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fagūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 139</bibl></cit>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prob. root <foreign lang="greek">fag</foreign>-, to eat; cf. faba and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fhgo/s, fhgw/n</foreign>; Germ. Buche; Engl. beech, originally a tree with edible fruit</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">fhgo/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a beech-tree</hi>: Fagus silvatica, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:16 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 5, 6, § 16 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:14" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 5, 9, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 92</bibl>: felices arbores ... quercus, fagus, etc., Veran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 20, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
fagutalis: <entryFree id="n17586" type="main" key="Fa_gu_ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fāgūtālis</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fācūt-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fagus</etym>, lit., <sense id="n17586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the beech-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus,</quote> <trans><tr>a grove sacred to Jupiter</tr>, <tr>on the Esquiline hill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=49" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 49</bibl></cit> Müll. sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, Juppiter,</quote> <trans><tr>as worshipped there</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 15, § 37</bibl></cit>.—And <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fāgūtal</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the shrine of Jupiter situated there</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=87" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=340" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 340</bibl>, a; 348, b Müll.</sense></entryFree>
fala: <entryFree id="n17587" type="main" key="fa^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">phal-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>falae dictae ab altitudine, a falando, quod apud Etruscos significat caelum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=88:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 88, 12</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n17587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scaffolding</hi> of boards or planks, <hi rend="ital">a scaffold.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17587.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A structure used in sieges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from which missiles were thrown into a city</hi>: malos diffindunt, fiunt tabulata falaeque, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 114, 7</bibl> (Ann. v. 389 ed. Vahl.).—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">subire sub falas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to run a great risk for a slight gain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17587.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the seven wooden pillars in the</hi> spina <hi rend="ital">of the Circus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:590" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 590</bibl>; cf. Anthon's Dict. of Antiq. p. 254, a.</sense></entryFree>
falacer: <entryFree id="n17588" type="main" key="Fa^la^ce^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fălăcĕr</orth>, <itype>cris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n17588.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of an</hi> <cb n="FALE" /> <hi rend="ital">Italian mythical hero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:15:section=84" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 15, § 84</bibl> Müll.; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:3:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 3, § 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17588.1" n="II" level="1"> = flamen: <cit><quote lang="la">flamen a divo patre Falacre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=84" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 84</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 100, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
falanius: <entryFree id="n17589" type="main" key="Falani^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Falanĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n17589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman knight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
falarica: <entryFree id="n17590" type="main" key="fa^la_ri^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fălārĭca</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">phal-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fala</etym>, <sense id="n17590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of missile wrapped with tow and pitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set on fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and thrown by the catapult</hi> (cf. for syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">tragula, sagitta, sparus, spicula, telum, missile, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:10 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 8, 10 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:351" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 351</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:239" default="NO">9, 239</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 198</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 18</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n17590.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a similar missile thrown by hand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 705</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 555, 15</bibl> (Ann. v. 534 ed. Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 14, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 342</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
falcarius: <entryFree id="n17591" type="main" key="falca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>falx</etym>, <sense id="n17591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sickle</hi>- or <hi rend="ital">scythe-maker</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dico te priore nocte venisse inter falcarios,</quote> <trans><tr>to scythe-makers' street</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 18, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
falcastrum: <entryFree id="n17592" type="gloss" key="falcastrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falcastrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an agricultural instrument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bush-hook</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a similitudine falcis vocatum. Est autem ferramentum curvum cum manubrio longo ad densitatem veprium succidendam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
falcatus: <entryFree id="n17593" type="main" key="falca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">armed with scythes.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17593.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus, quadrigae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 41, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 4</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 75; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:105" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:387" default="NO">387</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17593.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sickle-shaped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hooked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falcated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">en sis,</quote> <trans><tr>a falchion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 717</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 727</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:681" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 681</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 229</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
falcicula: <entryFree id="n17594" type="main" key="falci^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falcĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small sickle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 209</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
falcidius: <entryFree id="n17595" type="main" key="Falci^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Falcĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n17595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman gentile name</hi>, So the tribunes of the people, C. and P. Falcidius, <hi rend="ital">the former a contemporary of Cicero</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 19, 58</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the latter in the time of the second triumvirate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after whom is named the</hi> Lex Falcidia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35</bibl>, tit. 2.—</sense><sense id="n17595.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n17595.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Falcĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Falcidius</hi>: lex, <hi rend="ital">the law of Falcidius respecting bequests</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which provided that no Roman citizen should by testament divert more than three fourths of his estate from his legal heirs</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 1</bibl> sqq.— Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Falcidia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the portion secured to an heir by the Falcidian law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 5</bibl>; ib. § 14.—</sense><sense id="n17595.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Falcĭdĭ-ānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Falcidius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Falcidian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 36, 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
falcifer: <entryFree id="n17596" type="main" key="falci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falcĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>falx + fero</etym>, <sense id="n17596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sickle-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">holding a scythe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sickle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17596.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">covinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:418" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:930" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 930</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17596.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Saturn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:218" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tonans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:16:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
falciger: <entryFree id="n17597" type="hapax" key="falci^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falcĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>falx+gero</etym>, <sense id="n17597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sickle-bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caeligena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. de Fer. Rom. 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
falcipedius: <entryFree id="n17598" type="main" key="falci^pe^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falcĭpĕdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>falx + pes</etym>, <sense id="n17598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bandy-legged</hi>, Petr 75 dub. (al. fulcipedius).</sense></entryFree>
falco: <entryFree id="n17599" type="greek" key="falco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>v. flecto</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">fa/lkwn</foreign>, <sense id="n17599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a falcon.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17599.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 10, 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 7, 57 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17599.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: falcones dicuntur, quorum digiti pollices in pedibus intro sunt curvati, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=88:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 88, 8</bibl> Müll.; cf. falcula, II. A.</sense></entryFree>
falcula: <entryFree id="n17600" type="main" key="falcu^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>falx</etym>, <sense id="n17600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small sickle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bill-hook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pruning-hook.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17600.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17600.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a talon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">claw</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 15, 17, § 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17601" type="main" key="Falcula2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Falcula</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n17601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 10, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 37, 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
falere: <entryFree id="n17602" type="main" key="fa^le_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fălēre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fala</etym>, <sense id="n17602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pile</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pedestal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 14</bibl> and 16.</sense></entryFree>
falerii: <entryFree id="n17603" type="main" key="Fa^le_ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fălērĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n17603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital of the</hi> Falisci, <hi rend="ital">a Tuscan people</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Civita Castellana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 27, 4</bibl>; v. Falisci.</sense></entryFree>
falernus: <entryFree id="n17604" type="main" key="Fa^lernus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fălernus ăger</orth>, <sense id="n17604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Falernian territory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famed for its wines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the foot of Mount Massicus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14</bibl>. 6, 8, § 62; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Faler no,</quote> <trans><tr>in Falernus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17604.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fălernus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from the Falernian territory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Falernian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 73: <cit><quote lang="la">cellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 55</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mons, i. e. Massicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, <pb n="721" /> <cb n="FALL" /> 16; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 53</bibl></cit>: tribus, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> tribus rustica <hi rend="ital">in Campania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 20, 6</bibl> (al. Falerina).—</sense><sense id="n17604.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fălernum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n17604.3" n="a" level="4"> (Sc. vinum.) <hi rend="ital">Falernian wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Falernian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 19</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 115</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 34 al.</bibl>; also as <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> (sc. cadi): <cit><quote lang="la">fumosi Falerni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:27" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17604.4" n="b" level="4"> (Sc. praedium.) <hi rend="ital">The name of a country seat of Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 62, 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
falisca: <entryFree id="n17605" type="main" key="fa^lisca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fălisca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n17605.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
falisci: <entryFree id="n17606" type="main" key="Fa^lisci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fălisci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n17606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of their relationship to the Aequi called also</hi> Aequi Falisci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 13, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:223" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 695</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Their capital</hi> was called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fălisca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 51</bibl>; or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fălisci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 18</bibl>; or, as altered by the Romans, Falerii, v. h. v.—</sense><sense id="n17606.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Făliscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Falerii</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:84" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 4, 4, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <trans><tr>a sort of haggess</tr>, <tr>a large sausage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=111" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 111</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:5:35" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:46:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 46, 8</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n17606.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fălisca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a rack in a manger</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
falla: <entryFree id="n17607" type="hapax" key="falla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fallo</etym>, = fallacia, <sense id="n17607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an artifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trick</hi>, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 109, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fallacia: <entryFree id="n17608" type="main" key="falla_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fallācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<case>abl.</case> also fallacie, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 171</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fallax</etym>, <sense id="n17608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deceit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stratagem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">craft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrigue</hi> (class.; in Cic. only plur.; syn.: fraus, dolus, astus, astutia, calliditas). </sense><sense id="n17608.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n17608.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne ab imis unguibus usque ad verticem summum ex fraude, fallaciis, mendaciis constare totus videtur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doli, machinae, fallaciae, praestigiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudes atque fallaciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 36, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulatione et fallaciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine fuco ac fallaciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot admoenivi fabricas! quot fallacias!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—So in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 37</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17608.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per malitiam et per dolum et fallaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 31, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 16, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ausculta quod superest fallaciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16:7 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16, 7 al.</bibl>—Of magical art, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:19 al" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 19 al.</bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">fallacia alia aliam trudit,</quote> <trans><tr>one lie begets another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17608.4" n="II" level="1"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ipsa res habet aliquam fallaciam,</quote> <trans><tr>deception</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:68" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Hebr. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 13, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fallacies: <entryFree id="n17609" type="main" key="falla_ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fallācĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, v. fallacia <sense id="n17609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fallaciloquus: <entryFree id="n17610" type="hapax" key="falla_ci^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fallācĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fallaxloquor</etym>, <sense id="n17610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking deceitfully</hi> or <hi rend="ital">falsely</hi>: fallaciloquae malitiae, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:25:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 25, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fallaciosus: <entryFree id="n17611" type="main" key="falla_ci^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fallācĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fallacia</etym>, <sense id="n17611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceptive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fallacious</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta (with vafra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:34" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambages,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 205, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fallacitas: <entryFree id="n17612" type="main" key="falla_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fallācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fallax</etym>, <sense id="n17612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deceit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artifice</hi>, = fallacia, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Amic. 46, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fallaciter: <entryFree id="n17613" type="main" key="falla_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fallācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fallax <sense id="n17613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fallax: <entryFree id="n17614" type="main" key="fallax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fallax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype> (<sense id="n17614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> fallacium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:91 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 91 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but fallacum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 30, 4</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fallo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceptive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fallacious</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: captiosus, fraudulentus, subdolus, dolosus, vafer, astutus, callidus): age, barbari (astrologi) vani atque fallaces: num etiam Graiorum historia mentita est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:19:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 19, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levium hominum atque fallacium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 91</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: facta impia fallacum hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinitas non assueta mendaciis, non fucosa, non fallax, non erudita artificio simulationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posita fallacis imagine tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.—Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tamquam in herbis non fallacibus fructus appareat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(with fucosae) merces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siliquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">austri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:850" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 850</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba veneni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 34, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus tutius sed magis fallax (sc. venandi),</quote> <trans><tr>more uncertain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 8, 8, § 26</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">spe falsa atque fallaci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 34, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et captiosae interrogationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitatio simulatioque virtutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 46, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malitia est versuta et fallax nocendi ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 75</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: fallaces <cb n="FALL" /> sunt rerum species, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:34:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 34, 1</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallacior undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:799" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 799</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim fallacius illis (vocibus)?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 687</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum fallacissimo sensu judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 43, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17614.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines amicitiae fallaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17614.2" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Planasia navigiis fallax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 80</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fallācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">deceitfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fallaciously</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">falso, perperam): ratio hoc postulat, ne quid insidiose, ne quid simulate, ne quid fallaciter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 18, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:25:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 25, 90</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallacissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 16, 35, § 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fallo: <entryFree id="n17615" type="main" key="fallo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fallo</orth>, <itype>fĕfelli, falsum, 3</itype> (archaic <sense id="n17615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. praes. pass.</hi> fallier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:50" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 50</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf. pass.</hi> fefellitus sum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Fragm. 61</bibl>, MSS.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. sphal, sphul, to waver; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sfa/llw, a)-sfalh/s</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dupe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappoint</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: decipio, impono, frustror, circumvenio, emungo, fraudo). </sense><sense id="n17615.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n17615.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Of living objects: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Roscius non unum rei pecuniariae socium fefellit, verum novem homines honestissimos ejusdem muneris, etc. ... induxit, decepit, destituit, omni fraude et perfidia fefellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:116 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 116 sq.</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem dolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">referam gratiam, atque eas itidem fallam, ut ab illis fallimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 93</bibl></cit>: tu illum fructu fallas, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ipsum sui fallendi causa milites ab hostibus factum existimabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 50, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum laqueis captare feras et fallere visco Inventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 139</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 474</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is enim sum, nisi me forte fallo, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num me fefellit, Catilina, non modo res tanta, verum dies?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi me fallit animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 17, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eum prima opinio fefellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:67:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 67, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne spes eum fallat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in hominibus eligendis spes amicitiae nos fefellerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo cum eum opinio fefellisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte me animus fallit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi memoria me fallit,</quote> <trans><tr>fails me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20, p. 285" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, p. 285</bibl></cit> Bip.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi me omnia fallunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia me fallunt, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi quid me fallit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid nunc me fallit in scribendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominum sterilis saepe fefellit ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe hercle hic se ipsus fallit, non ego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam libenter se fallunt, quam si una fata decipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alios falleret, se ipsum tamen non fefellit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 22, 5</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> in mid. force, <hi rend="ital">to deceive one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be deceived</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to err</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be mistaken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">errore quodam fallimur in disputando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua (spe) possumus falli: deus falli qui potuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriā falli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 59, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque dies, nisi fallor, adest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni fallor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:623" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 623</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 19, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinis haec virtus erit et venus, aut ego fallor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 42</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere non fallar, quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam haut falsa sum, nos odiosas haberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">id quam facile sit mihi, haud sum falsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ea res falsum me habuit,</quote> <trans><tr>did not deceive me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut falsus animi est!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17615.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Of inanim. or abstr. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">promissum,</quote> <trans><tr>not to fulfil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:10:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem hosti datam fallere,</quote> <trans><tr>to violate</tr>, <tr>break</tr>, <tr>betray</tr>, <tr>deceive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi meam spem vis improborum fefellerit atque superaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 11, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fallam opinionem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 86 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <trans><tr>to fail to execute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 37, 38, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lubrica saxa vestigium fallerent,</quote> <trans><tr>betrayed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu faciem illius Falle dolo,</quote> <trans><tr>imitate deceptively</tr>, <tr>assume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:684" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 684</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua terga nocturno lupo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to hide</tr>, <tr>conceal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:5:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casses, retia,</quote> <trans><tr>to shun</tr>, <tr>avoid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">190</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n17615.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: neque quo pacto fallam ... Scio quicquam, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum maxime fallunt, id agunt, ut viri boni esse videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (divinatio) fallit fortasse nonnumquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 14, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non in sortitione fallere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ea re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 2</bibl>: ne falleret bis relata eadem<cb n="FALL" />  res, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 35, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, si quid possent, de induciis fallendo impetrarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">germinat et numquam fallentis termes olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:45" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerumque sufflati atque tumidi (oratores) fallunt pro uberibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:14:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17615.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: fallit (me) <hi rend="ital">I deceive myself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I mistake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">am mistaken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed nos, nisi me fallit, jacebimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi me propter benevolentiam forte fallebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 19, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:50:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 50, 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec eum fefellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide, ne te fallat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>. And cf. under II. B. 2.</sense><sense id="n17615.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17615.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To deceive in swearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swear falsely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is jurare cum coepisset, vox eum defecit in illo loco: SI SCIENS FALLO,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidem silicem tenebant juraturi per Jovem haec verba dicentes: SI SCIENS FALLO, TVM ME DISPITER, etc., Paul. ex Fest. s. v. lapidem, p. 115 Müll.: si sciens fefellisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:64:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 64, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 45, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:7:53" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 7, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">expedit matris cineres opertos Fallere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to swear falsely by the ashes of your mother</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17615.8" n="B" level="2"> With respect to one's knowledge or sight, for the more usual latēre: <hi rend="ital">to lie concealed from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to escape the notice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elude the observation of</hi> a person (so in Cic., Sall., and Caes. for the most part only impers., v. 2. infra). </sense><sense id="n17615.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim hoc te, Crasse, fallit, quam multa sint et quam varia genera dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto silentio in summum evasere, ut non custodes solum fallerent, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec fefellit veniens ducem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 19, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 6, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quin et Atridas duce te (Mercurio) ... Priamus ... Thessalosque ignes et iniqua Trojae Castra fefellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos fallere et effugere est triumphus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Spartacum si qua potuit vagantem Fallere testa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec te Pythagorae fallant arcana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:21" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam eos, quae terra marique agerentur, fallebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 2, 1</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut plebem tribunosque falleret judicii rescindendi consilium initum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta celeritate, ut visum fallant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 50, 74, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos littera fallit,</quote> <trans><tr>cannot be distinctly read</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 627</bibl></cit>.— With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neutros fefellit hostes appropinquare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 33, 8</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.—Mid. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec satis exaudiebam, nec sermonis fallebar tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17615.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to escape notice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be unseen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain undiscovered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculator Carthaginiensium, qui per biennium fefellerat, Romae deprehensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 33, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes fallendi, resistendive, si non falleret,</quote> <trans><tr>of remaining unnoticed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:57:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 57, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fefellere ad Tifernum hostes instructi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 14, 6</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:64:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 64, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 19, 11</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>: ne alio itinere hostis falleret ad urbem incedens, i. e. <hi rend="ital">arrive secretly</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">lanqa/noi prosiw/n</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 20, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 47, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 350</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vixit male, qui natus moriensque fefellit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>has remained unnoticed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallere pro aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus longe fallente sagitta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 572</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17615.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: fallit (me), <hi rend="ital">it is concealed from me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unknown to me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I do not know</hi>, <hi rend="ital">am ignorant of</hi> (for the most part only with negatives or in negative interrogations), constr. with <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non me fefellit: sensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num me fefellit, hosce id struere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in lege nulla esse ejusmodi capita, te non fallit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec me animi fallit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:97" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem fallit?</quote> <trans><tr>who does not know?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vero Caesarem fefellit, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B C. 3, 94, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17615.12" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cause any thing</hi> (space, time, etc.) <hi rend="ital">not to be observed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">felt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lighten any thing difficult</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to appease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silence any thing disagreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to beguile</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">medias fallunt sermonibus horas Sentirique moram prohibent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 652</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam somno fallere curam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fallebat curas aegraque corda labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:2:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:7:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:319" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molliter austerum studio fallente laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 7, 28, § 49</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">fallere credentem non est operosa puellam Gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 63</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">falsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">deceptive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feigned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spurious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">false</hi> (syn.: adulterinus, subditus, subditicius, spurius). </sense><sense id="n17615.13" n="A" level="2"> <pb n="722" /> <cb n="FALL" /> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes aut casu veri aut malitia falsi fictique esse possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:11:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">falsum est id totum, neque solum fictum, sed etiam imperite absurdeque fictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ementita et falsa plenaque erroris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 21, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro re certa spem falsam domum retulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 110</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spe falsa atque fallaci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:82:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 82, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsa et mendacia visa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:62:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 62, 127</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">falsa et inania visa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsum et imitatione simulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 189</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:48:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 48, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui falsas lites falsis testimoniis Petunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reperiuntur falsi falsimoniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitio multos mortales falsos fieri subegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 5</bibl></cit> Kritz.: <cit><quote lang="la">pater (opp. verus),</quote> <trans><tr>a supposed father</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:754" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 754</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsi ac festinantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: suspectio, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 511, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena falsarum et corruptarum litterarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 17, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">falsas esse litteras et a scriba vitiatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 55, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsarum tabularum rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">terrores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opprobria,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>undeserved</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">honor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 39</bibl></cit>: falsi Simoëntis ad undam, i. e. <hi rend="ital">fictitious</hi> (simulati), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 302</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">falsi sequimur vestigia tauri (i. e. Jovis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:265" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu simulans Haliagmona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:739" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 739</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ceteros terruere, ut adesse omnem exercitum trepidi ac falsi nuntiarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne illi falsi sunt qui divorsissumas res pariter expectant,</quote> <trans><tr>deceived</tr>, <tr>mistaken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">falsus utinam vates sim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 46, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quanto est abjectior et falsior ista (theologia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 7:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est hominum inepta persuasione falsius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=92:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 92, 11</bibl> Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id autem falsissimum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17615.14" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Felix appellatur Arabia, falsi et ingrati cognominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 18, 41, § 82</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17615.15" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">False</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterfeit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spurious</hi>, = adulterinus (late Lat.): moneta, Cod. Th. 9, 21, 9.— </sense><sense id="n17615.16" n="B" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17615.17" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">falsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a liar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceiver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Spurinnam ut falsum arguens,</quote> <trans><tr>a false prophet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17615.18" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">falsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">falsehood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex falsis verum effici non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:51:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 51, 106</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">veris falsa remiscet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vero distinguere falsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsum scripseram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex illa causa falsi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of fraud</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 10</bibl></cit> (De lege Cornelia de falsis), 1; <cit><quote lang="la">v. the whole title: acclinis falsis animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec obstitit falsis Tiberius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulationum falsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 46</bibl></cit> et saep.—Adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">telisque non in falsum jactis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not at random</tr>, <tr>with effect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurare falsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untruly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erroneously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfaithfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falsely;</hi> in two forms, <orth extent="full" lang="la">falso</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">false</orth>. </sense><sense id="n17615.19" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">falso</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">eho mavis vituperari falso, quam vero extolli?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:21 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 21 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 173</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:2:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: ei rei dant operam, ut mihi falso maledicatur, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 179</bibl> P.: falso criminare, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 470, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque me perpetiar probri Falso insimulatam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non possum quemquam insimulare falso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:41:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 41, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falso memoriae proditum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Tarquinius ... vivere falso diceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adesse ejus equites falso nuntiabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum utrumque falso fingerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falso in me conferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: aliquem falso occidere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">by mistake</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 179</bibl> P.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut miseri parentes quos falso lugent, vivere sciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 32, 13</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">falso lamentari eas Darium vivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falso queritur de natura sua genus humanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falso plurima volgus amat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:20" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit> (so perh. also in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 46, 141</bibl>, non assentiar saepe falso, instead of false).—Ellipt.: <hi rend="ital">Da.</hi> Si quid narrare occepi, continuo dari tibi verba censes. <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Falso, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 24</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">atqui in talibus rebus aliud utile interdum, aliud honestum videri solet. Falso: nam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:18:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 18, 74</bibl></cit>; so <cb n="FAMA" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia inter inpotentes et validos falso quiescas, = quia falluntur qui putant quiesci posse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Germ. 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17615.20" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">false</orth> (very rare): judicium false factum, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 78</bibl> Fleck. (<bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 46, 141</bibl> dub., B. and K., al. falso).—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae adversus haec falsissime disputantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 10:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 10, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
falsarius: <entryFree id="n17616" type="main" key="falsa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falsārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>falsus, from fallo</etym>, <sense id="n17616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forger</hi> of written documents, wills, etc. (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:9:1 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 9, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
falsatio: <entryFree id="n17617" type="main" key="falsa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falsātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>falsatus</etym>, <sense id="n17617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a falsifying</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ruf. 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
falsatus: <entryFree id="n17618" type="main" key="falsa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falsātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 1. falso.</entryFree>
false: <entryFree id="n17619" type="main" key="false"><orth extent="full" lang="la">false</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fallo, <sense id="n17619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi> 2.</sense></entryFree>
falsidicentia: <entryFree id="n17620" type="main" key="falsi^di^centia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falsĭdĭcentia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>falsidicus</etym>, <sense id="n17620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">habitual falsehood</hi> (opp. veridicentia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
falsidicus: <entryFree id="n17621" type="main" key="falsi^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falsĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>falsus-dico</etym>, <sense id="n17621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking falsely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">fallaciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 40</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 709</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 118, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
falsificatus: <entryFree id="n17622" type="hapax" key="falsi^fi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falsĭfĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>falsificus</etym>, <sense id="n17622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">falsified</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 551</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
falsificus: <entryFree id="n17623" type="main" key="falsi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falsĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>falsus + facio</etym>, <sense id="n17623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that acts falsely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">glossema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
falsijurius: <entryFree id="n17624" type="main" key="falsi^ju_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falsĭjūrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>falsus + jus</etym>, <sense id="n17624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that swears falsely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">glossema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
falsiloquium: <entryFree id="n17625" type="main" key="falsi^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falsĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>falsiloquus</etym>, <sense id="n17625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">false speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falsehood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. Retract. praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
falsiloquus: <entryFree id="n17626" type="main" key="falsi^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falsĭlŏquus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-locus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>falsus + loquor</etym>, <sense id="n17626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that speaks falsehoods</hi>: quarum rerum te falsilocum mihi esse nolo. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 107</bibl>; also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 36</bibl>, glossema.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fal-sĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a false accuser</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 16, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
