falsimonia: <entryFree id="n17627" type="hapax" key="falsi^mo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falsĭmōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>falsus, from fallo</etym>, <sense id="n17627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos cum censeas Esse amicos, reperiuntur falsi falsimoniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
falsiparens: <entryFree id="n17628" type="hapax" key="falsi^pa^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falsĭ-părens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>falsus</etym>, <sense id="n17628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has a pretended father</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amphitryoniades, i. e. Hercules, as only the reputed son of Amphitryo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 112</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
falsitas: <entryFree id="n17629" type="main" key="falsi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">falsehood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falsity</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 3, 23</bibl> (opp. verum); <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:4:65" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 4, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 1, 20, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
falso: <entryFree id="n17630" type="main" key="falso1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to falsify</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pondera aut mensuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 10, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripturas divinas, Ambros. de Fide, 2, 15, 135: liber falsatus ab haereticis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ruf. 2, 5 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">falsātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">falsified</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. de Virt. Monach. 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17631" type="main" key="falso2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falso</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fallo, <sense id="n17631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>
falsus: <entryFree id="n17632" type="main" key="falsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from fallo.</entryFree>
falx: <entryFree id="n17633" type="main" key="falx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">falx</orth>, <itype>falcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. akin to flecto</etym>, <sense id="n17633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sickle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reaping-hook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pruning-hook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scythe.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17633.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 33, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 348</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:914" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 914</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 9</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17633.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a military implement shaped like a sickle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used in sieges to pull down walls or the enemies stationed on the walls; a hook</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">falces praeacutae insertae affixaeque longuriis: non absimili formā muralium falcium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 42</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 7, 22; Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 556, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:2:419" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 2, 419</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">scythes with which chariots were armed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fama: <entryFree id="n17634" type="main" key="fa_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for, fa-ri</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">fh/mh</foreign>, <sense id="n17634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the talk of the multitude</hi>, like rumor, either as relating or as judging (v. rumor; cf. also: nomen, gloria, laudatio; clamor, plausus; honos, dignitas, honestas, laus, etc.). </sense><sense id="n17634.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That which people say</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the common talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rumor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tradition</hi> (freq. and class.; <number>plur.</number> very rare); <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, or with a statement of the subject-matter annexed with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, or as an <hi rend="ital">object-clause;</hi> rarely with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17634.2" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hascine propter res maledicas famas ferunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 149</bibl></cit>: a Brundisio nulla adhuc <cb n="FAMA" /> fama venerat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tristis a Mutina fama manaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at fuit fama. Quotusquisque est, qui istam effugere potest in tam maledica civitate?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 16, 38</bibl></cit>: magna illico fama surrexit, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquod fama ac nuntiis afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac fama ad Treviros perlata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 53, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquos (deos) ne famā quidem acceperunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 21, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam Eratostheni et quibusdam Graecis famā notam esse video,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concedamus famae hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Daedalus, ut fama est, fugiens, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsis (vetus est ut fama) Sabellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fama ferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplex inde fama est,</quote> <trans><tr>a twofold tradition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhonestas famas adjungere diis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnem provinciam magnae atrocesque famae ibant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 67</bibl></cit> Dietsch, ex conj.—</sense><sense id="n17634.3" n="b" level="4"> Stating the subject-matter or contents. </sense><sense id="n17634.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis quid de republica a finitimis rumore aut fama acceperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid ipsi audistis communi fama atque sermone de vi, de manu, de armis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de interitu P. Clodii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 35, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Afranio fama est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Titurii morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 39, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de victoria Caesaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 53, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 51, 1: de proelio Dyrrhachino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 80</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: ingentes esse famas de Regulo, Arrunt. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17634.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">appos. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne mihi hanc famam differant, Me ... dedisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 63</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. differo, B. 2.: accipere fama et auditione, esse quoddam numen et vim deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tibi esse antiquissimum constante famā atque omnium sermone celebratum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8, § 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">constans fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esse praestantem Numam Pompilium fama ferret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fama per orbem terrarum percrebuisset, illum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama nuntiabat, te esse in Syria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama incerta duos equites venisse,</quote> <trans><tr>a vague rumor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:50:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 50, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capsis quem (Cassium) fama est esse librisque Ambustum propriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:63 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 63 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17634.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix ad aures meas istius suspicionis fama pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter incertam famam aeris alieni,</quote> <trans><tr>an unsupported rumor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 27, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17634.7" n="B" level="2"> Personified: Fama, <hi rend="ital">a goddess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of</hi> Terra, <hi rend="ital">swiftfooted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all-seeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growing as she runs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fama, malum qua non aliud velocius ullum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:173 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 173 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:43 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 43 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:116 sq" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 116 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:426 sq" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 426 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 267</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 137</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 726</bibl>; 15, 4; 853 al.</sense><sense id="n17634.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The voice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">judgment of the many</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public opinion;</hi> more freq. objectively, <hi rend="ital">the fame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">character</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reputation</hi> which a man has, either in general or in particular, as a <hi rend="ital">good</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bad reputation</hi>, etc. (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n17634.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">famam atque rumores pars altera consensum civitatis et velut publicum testimonium vocat: altera sermonem sine ullo certo auctore dispersum, cui malignitas initium dederit, incrementum credulitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus famam rumoresque hominum si satis firmus steteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra opinionem militum famamque omnium videri proelium defugisse, magnum detrimentum afferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:82:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 82, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 56</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: fama popularis, <hi rend="ital">popular fame</hi> or <hi rend="ital">favor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 16, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 5:17" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: de bona fama (quam enim appellant <foreign lang="greek">eu)doci/an</foreign>, aptius est hoc loco bonam famam appellare quam gloriam), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 17, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona de Domitio, praeclara de Afranio fama est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui bonam famam bonorum, quae sola vere gloria nominari potest, expetunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:66:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 66, 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bonam famam mihi servasso, sat ero dives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:70 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 70 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene loquendi fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:259" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 74, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 32</bibl></cit> (3, 30), 21: <cit><quote lang="la">alium mala fama et timor impediebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconstantiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vappae ac nebulonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: inter arma civilia aequi boni famas petit, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 19</bibl> (Hist. inc. l<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:76" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 76</bibl> Dietsch).—</sense><sense id="n17634.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17634.11" n="1" level="3"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">fair fame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reputation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renown</hi>, = existumatio, fama bona: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vos mihi domi eritis, proinde ego ero famā foris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: fundamentum <pb n="723" /> <cb n="FAME" /> est perpetuae commendationis et famae justitia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 20, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama et existimatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ante collectam famam conservet (for which, shortly after: habet existimationem multo sudore collectam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:22:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 22, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ejus (Archiae) adventus celebrabantur, ut famam ingenii exspectatio hominis superaret ... hac tanta celebritate famae cum esset jam absentibus notus, etc. (shortly before: celeriter antecellere omnibus ingenii gloriā contigit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so corresp. to gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama ingeni abicienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with the latter cf.: anxius de fama ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:74" default="NO">74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de alicujus fama detrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam in tuto collocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus scripta tantum intra famam sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad famam populi Romani pertinere, eos consules esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:24:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 24, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ut amicorum) aut caput agatur aut fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loco, fortuna, fama superiores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus, fama, decus divitiis parent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui gratia, fama, valetudo, contingat abunde,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam dicendi fortius quaerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: Evadne ... Occidit Argivae fama pudicitiae, <hi rend="ital">the glory</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pride of Argive chastity</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the chaste women of Argos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 22</bibl>.—Esp.: magna fama, <hi rend="ital">great reputation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam famam attulisse Fabio Tarentum rebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 25, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam famam sui relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 21, 39, § 149</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17634.12" n="2" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">illfame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scandal</hi>, = infamia, fama mala (rare): opplere (aliquem) famā ac flagitiis, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 306, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque specie famāve movetur, Nec jam furtivum Dido meditatur amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 172</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:28:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 28, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laeta apud plerosque, apud quosdam sinistra fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
famatus: <entryFree id="n17635" type="main" key="fa_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fama, II. B. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n17635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in bad odor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notorious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disreputable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus criminibus haec causa famata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 13</bibl></cit> dub. (al., ex conject., diffamata): tonsor Licinus, Schol. Cruq. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 301</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
famel: <entryFree id="n17636" type="gloss" key="famel"><orth extent="full" lang="la">famel</orth>, v. famulus <sense id="n17636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
famelice: <entryFree id="n17637" type="gloss" key="fa^me_li^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămēlĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. famelicus <sense id="n17637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
famelico: <entryFree id="n17638" type="main" key="fa^me_li^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămēlĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>famelicus</etym>, <sense id="n17638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make hungry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to famish</hi>: non famelicas sed reficis, Pseud. <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> ad Fratr. Erem. Serm. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
famelicosus: <entryFree id="n17639" type="gloss" key="fa^me_li^co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămēlĭcōsus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">boulimiw/dhs</foreign>, Gloss. Philox. [famelicus].</entryFree>
famelicus: <entryFree id="n17640" type="main" key="fa^me_li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămēlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fames</etym>, <sense id="n17640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suffering from hunger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">starved</hi> (mostly ante- and post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): lassus et famelicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famelica hominum natio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales, with rapacissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 10, 12, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:146" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 146</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fămēlĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a hungry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">famished person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one suffering from hunger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ille miser famelicus videt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 5, 5</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Reg. 2, 5</bibl>. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium,</quote> <trans><tr>meagre</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 114</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">fămēlĭce</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">limochro/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">hungrily</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
famella: <entryFree id="n17641" type="gloss" key="fa_mella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāmella</orth>, <lbl>dim.</lbl> a fama, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=87:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 87, 17</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
fames: <entryFree id="n17642" type="main" key="fa^mes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămes</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (ante- and post-class. <sense id="n17642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">famis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 479</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: fami, Cato and Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:14:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 14, 10</bibl>; <case>abl.</case>, scanned fămē, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 732</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 421</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 165</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 846</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 370 al.</bibl>) <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root gha-; Sanscr. gahami, to leave, abandon; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xa/tis, xh=tos</foreign>, want; <foreign lang="greek">xh=ros</foreign>, deprived of</etym>, <hi rend="ital">hunger</hi> (syn.: inedia, jejunium, esuries, esuritio). </sense><sense id="n17642.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">interficere aliquem siti fameque atque algu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum cibo et potione fames sitisque depulsa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi condimentum esse famem, potionis sitim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae fame monitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 25, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fame atque inopia rerum omnium confecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:51:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 51, § 134</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">(avis) fame enecta,</quote> <trans><tr>starved to death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 35, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem fame necare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patientia famis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: famem explere, <hi rend="ital">to satiate</hi>, id. pro Dom. 23: <cit><quote lang="la">tolerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremam famem sustentare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duram propellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pellere querna glande,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:38" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propulsare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; Tac. <cb n="FAMI" /> A. 14, 24: <cit><quote lang="la">deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:530" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levare,</quote> <trans><tr>to assuage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 14, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincere sacris extis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:347" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 347</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in principio fame utendum,</quote> <trans><tr>the patient must fast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">primis diebus fames, deinde liberalius alimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitiosa non est fames,</quote> <trans><tr>is not nice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 119:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 119, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum panem tibi tenerum et siligineum fames reddet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 123:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 123, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17642.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17642.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Famine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dearth</hi> (rare in class. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fames, quae tum erat in hac mea Asia: messis enim nulla fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames esse coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fame frumentum exportare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ruth, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 24, 7</bibl> et saep.— * </sense><sense id="n17642.4" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">poverty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indigence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad famem reicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n17642.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17642.6" n="A" level="2"> Like sitis, <hi rend="ital">a violent longing</hi> for any thing, <hi rend="ital">greediness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avidity</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quid non mortalia pectora cogis, Auri sacra fames!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 57</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">auri fames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 72</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti sitis importuna famesque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 3, § 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">auri fames durissima est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex longa fame satiaret se auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescentem sequitur cura pecuniam Majorumque fames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorum Marii fames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 6</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17642.7" n="B" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">poverty of expression</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejunitatem et famem malle quam ubertatem et copiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17642.8" n="C" level="2"> Personified: Fames, as <hi rend="ital">a goddess</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 276</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:784" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 784</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">785</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
famescens: <entryFree id="n17643" type="hapax" key="fa^mescens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămescens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [fames], <sense id="n17643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suffering hunger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hungering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora famescentum ferarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Avit. ad Sor. 738</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
famex: <entryFree id="n17644" type="main" key="famex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">famex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n17644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bruise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contusion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 2</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N cr.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 19</bibl>; cf. famex, <foreign lang="greek">qla/sma</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
famicosam: <entryFree id="n17645" type="gloss" key="famicosam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">famicosam</orth> <itype>terram palustrem vocabant</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=87:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 87, 4</bibl> Müll. [famex]</entryFree>
famiger: <entryFree id="n17646" type="gloss" key="fa_mi^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāmĭger</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">a)ggeliafo/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n17646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spreading reports</hi>, Gloss. Philox. [fama-gero].</sense></entryFree>
famigerabilis: <entryFree id="n17647" type="main" key="fa_mi^ge^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāmĭgĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fama-gero</etym>, <sense id="n17647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">famous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=55" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 55</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 105, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 124, 5.</sense></entryFree>
famigeratio: <entryFree id="n17648" type="main" key="fa_mi^ge^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāmĭgĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>famigeratus</etym>.— Prop., <sense id="n17648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tale-bearing.</hi>—Hence, concr., <hi rend="ital">a report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rumor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec famigeratio Te honestet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
famigerator: <entryFree id="n17649" type="main" key="fa_mi^ge^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāmĭgĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a talebearer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 178</bibl> and 182.</sense></entryFree>
famigeratus: <entryFree id="n17650" type="main" key="fa_mi^ge^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāmĭgĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [famigero], <sense id="n17650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">famed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Crete multis famigerata fabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famigeratum antiquitus fanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor p. 350, 32</bibl></cit>.—Cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
famigero: <entryFree id="n17651" type="gloss" key="fa_mi^ge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāmĭgĕro</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">diafhmi/cw</foreign>, Gloss. Philox. [fama-gero; cf. also the preced. art.].</entryFree>
familia: <entryFree id="n17652" type="main" key="fa^mi^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (with pater, mater, filius, and filia, the class. <sense id="n17652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> is usually in the archaic form familias; familiae also occurs, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiai,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 203</bibl></cit>; with the <number>plur.</number> of these words both the <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number> of familia are used: <cit><quote lang="la">patres familias, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:51:section=120 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 51, § 120 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres familiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:51:9" default="NO" valid="yes">51, 9</bibl>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> II. A. b.—On the form patribus familiis for familiae, patrum familiarum, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:79:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 79, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 48</bibl>, v. Neue, Formenl. 1, p. 7), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>famulus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the slaves in a household</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a household establishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">family servants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">domestics</hi> (not = <hi rend="ital">family</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">wife and children</hi>, domus, or mei, tui, sui, etc., but v. II. A. 3 infra): <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid male factum a nostra hic familia est ... ita senex talos elidi jussit conservis meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim dubium est, quin, si ad rem judicandum verbo ducimur, non re, familiam intelligamus, quae constet ex servis pluribus, quin unus homo familia non sit: verbum certe hoc non modo postulat, sed etiam cogit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 19, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:40:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 40, § 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 304</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilicus familiam exerceat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiae male ne sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te familiae interdicere, ut uni dicto audiens esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui emeret eam familiam a Catone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum insimularetur familia societatis ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 22, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugum et liberorum et familiarum suarum causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Petreius armat familiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:75:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 75, 2</bibl></cit>: alienae se familiae venali immiscuisse,<cb n="FAMI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aesopus domino solus cum esset familia,</quote> <trans><tr>formed the entire establishment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">serfs</hi> belonging to a temple: <cit><quote lang="la">illi Larini in Martis familia numerantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 15, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. of the <hi rend="ital">serfs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vassals</hi> of Orgetorix: <cit><quote lang="la">die constituta causae dictionis Orgetorix ad judicium omnem suam familiam, ad hominum milia decem undique coëgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n17652.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17652.2" n="A" level="2"> With the idea of house predominating. </sense><sense id="n17652.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a house and all belonging to it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a family estate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">family property</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortune</hi>: familiae appellatio varie accepta est: nam et in res et in personas deducitur; <cit><quote lang="la">in res, ut puta in lege XII. tab. his verbis: AGNATVS PROXIMVS FAMILIAM HABETO,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:195" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 195</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">SI AGNATVS NEC ESCIT, GENTILIS FAMILIAM NANCITOR, Fragm. XII. Tab. in Collat. Legg. Mosaic. et Roman. tit. 16, § 4 (cf. agnatus): idcirco qui, quibus verbis erctum cieri oporteat, nesciat, idem erciscundae familiae causam agere non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 237</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrum familiae erciscundae postulavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 7, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">familiae erciscundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10</bibl></cit>, tit. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">decem dierum vix mihi est familia,</quote> <trans><tr>means of support</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 36</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.—</sense><sense id="n17652.4" n="b" level="4"> Paterfamilias, materfamilias, etc., or paterfamiliae, materfamiliae, filiusfamilias, etc. (also written separately: pater familiae, mater familiae, etc.), <hi rend="ital">the master of a house</hi> in respect to ownership, <hi rend="ital">the proprietor of an estate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head of a family; the mistress of a house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">matron; a son or daughter under the father's power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a minor</hi>: paterfamilias appellatur, qui in domo dominium habet, recteque hoc nomine appellatur, quamvis filium non habeat; <cit><quote lang="la">non enim solam personam ejus, sed et jus demonstramus. Denique et pupillum patremfamilias appellamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:195" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 195</bibl></cit>; cf. Sandars ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 8</bibl> prooem.—</sense><sense id="n17652.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <hi rend="ital">familias</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterfamilias ubi ad villam venit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterfamilias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 497, 19</bibl> (Rep. 5, 3 ed. Mos.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes">13 al.</bibl>; cf., in gen., <hi rend="ital">of a plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordinary citizen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut unus paterfamilias his de rebus loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:de Or. 1:29:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 29, 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:34:159" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 34, 159</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">patresfamilias, qui liberos habent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:79:section=183 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 79, § 183 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Demaratus) cum de matrefamilias Tarquiniensi duo filios procreavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materfamilias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:46 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 46 al.</bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxoris duae formae: una matrumfamilias, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:3:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=62 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 62 al.</bibl>— <cit><quote lang="la">In an inverted order: familias matres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum filium familias patre parco ac tenaci habere tuis copiis devinctum non potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiusfamilias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:6:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 6, 1 sq.</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">tu filiafamilias locupletibus filiis ultro contulisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17652.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <hi rend="ital">familiae</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Amerina disciplina patrisfamiliae rusticani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:41:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 41, 120</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pater familiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 22 al.</bibl>: familiae mater, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=258" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 258</bibl> Müll.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauci milites patresque familiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 44, 1</bibl></cit>; Gracch. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 83</bibl> P.: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrem familiae tuam purpureum amiculum habere non sines?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater familiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 53, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Verg. Vel. 11</bibl>.— In <number>plur.</number>: matresfamiliae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 83</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 26, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 47, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17652.7" n="(g)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi>: civium Romanorum quidam sunt patresfamiliarum, alii filiifamiliarum, quaedam matresfamiliarum, quaedam filiaefamiliarum. Patresfamiliarum sunt, qui sunt suae potestatis, sive puberes sive impuberes; <cit><quote lang="la">simili modo matresfamiliarum, filii vero et filiaefamiliarum, qui sunt in aliena potestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: patresfamiliarum, Sisenn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=73" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 73</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matresfamiliarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiifamiliarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 43, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiaefamiliarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:6:9:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 6, 9, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrumfamiliarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:195" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 195</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17652.8" n="2" level="3"> In respect to relationship, <hi rend="ital">a family</hi>, as part of a gens: <cit><quote lang="la">addere nostrae lepidam famam familiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sororem despondere in fortem familiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: item appellatur familia plurium personarum, quae ab ejusdem ultimi genitoris sanguine proficiscuntur, sicuti dicimus familiam Juliam. Mulier autem familiae<pb n="724" /> <cb n="FAMI" />  suae et caput et finis est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:195" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 195 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua in familia laus aliqua forte floruerit, hanc fere, qui sunt ejusdem stirpis, cupidissime persequuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: EX EA FAMILIA ... IN EAM FAMILIAM, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:195" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 195</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commune dedecus familiae, cognationis, nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laeliorum et Muciorum familiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:72:252" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 72, 252</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilissima in familia natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex familia vetere et illustri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus in eam familiam attulit consulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes familiae vestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sulla gentis patriciae nobilis fuit, familia prope jam exstincta majorum ignavia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 95, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17652.9" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros, qui falso viderentur inscripti, tamquam subditicios, summovere familiā, permiserunt sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17652.10" n="3" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a family</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the members of a household</hi>, = domus (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">salutem dicit Toxilo Timarchides et familiae omni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si haec non nubat, fame familia pereat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne pateretur Philippi domus et familiae inimicissimos stirpem interimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17652.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A company</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">school</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troop</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum universi in te impetum fecissent, tum singulae familiae litem tibi intenderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 10</bibl></cit> 42: <cit><quote lang="la">familia tota Peripateticorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristoteles, Xenocrates, tota illa familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:18:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 18, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiae dissentientes inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:16:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 16, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia gladiatorum ... familia Fausti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanistarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42</bibl></cit>: tironum, <hi rend="ital">a company of young soldiers</hi>, Cod. Th. 10, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.—A troop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">company of players</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17652.12" n="2" level="3"> Ducere familiam, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to lead a company</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be at the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be the first</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucius quidem, frater ejus, familiam ducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">accedit etiam, quod familiam ducit in jure civili, singularis memoria summa scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissima illa vestra sententia, quae familiam ducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:16:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 16, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
familiaresco: <entryFree id="n17653" type="hapax" key="fa^mi^li^a_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămĭlĭāresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n17653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [familiaris], <hi rend="ital">to grow familiar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intimate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
familiaricus: <entryFree id="n17654" type="main" key="fa^mi^li^a_ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămĭlĭārĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n17654.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the house-servants</hi> or <hi rend="ital">domestics</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cellae,</quote> <trans><tr>rooms for the servants</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiarica vestimenta sunt, quae ad familiam vestiendam parata sunt, sicuti saga, tunicae, paenulae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17654.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of the house</hi> or <hi rend="ital">famity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sellae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>privies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
familiaris: <entryFree id="n17655" type="main" key="fa^mi^li^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămĭlĭāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<sense id="n17655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> regularly familiari; familiare, Varr. and P. Rutil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 105</bibl> P.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>familia</etym>. </sense><sense id="n17655.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to servants</hi> (rare; only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>): <orth extent="full" lang="la">fămĭlĭāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a servant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores nostri servos (quod etiam in mimis adhuc durat) familiares appellaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus familiae familiarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 203</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17655.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">household</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">family; household</hi>, <hi rend="ital">domestic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">family</hi>, <hi rend="ital">private</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">focus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiis familiaribus impediti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">res domesticae ac familiares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <trans><tr>the household</tr>, <tr>family affairs</tr>, <tr>property</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:9" default="NO">12, 7, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab domo ab re familiari, diutius abesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4, 6 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">copiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">referam nunc interiorem ac familiarem ejus vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis umquam in luctu domestico, quis in funere familiari cenavit cum toga pulla?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: parricidium, i. e. <hi rend="ital">committed on a member of the same family</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:26:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 26, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maeror,</quote> <trans><tr>a family grief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 27, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:11:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 11, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 5</bibl> Mos. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>, v. Lar; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">numen Minerva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17655.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17655.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Familiar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendly</hi>, and (more freq.) <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a familiar acquaintance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friend</hi> (syn.: amicus, familiaris, intimus, necessarius). </sense><sense id="n17655.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videmus Papum Aemilium C. Luscino familiarem fuisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduo factus est mihi familiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2</bibl>, <cb n="FAMI" /> 20; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 34, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 37, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 9, 1</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">epistolae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus familiari vultu respexisse,</quote> <trans><tr>friendly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voltus ille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colloquium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam inde a puero in omnia familiaria jura assuetus,</quote> <trans><tr>the rights of intimacy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:16:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vox auribus meis familiaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiaribus magis ei aetati exemplis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:44" default="NO">9, 4, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba regionibus quibusdam magis familiaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui familiarior nobis propter scriptorum multitudinem est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus in domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater ei (with carior),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo boves familiariores bubulco fiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color argenti militaribus signis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 58</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo amantissimus familiarissimus, conjunctissimus officiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 20, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl>, F. 17: <cit><quote lang="la">luna terris familiarissimum sidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:75" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 18, 30, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:131" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 31, 57, § 131</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17655.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">est ex meis domesticis atque intimis familiaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiaris meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per C. Valerium Procillum familiarem suum cum eo colloquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caelii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 25, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauci familiares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod M. Aemulius unus est ex meis familiarissimis atque intimis maxime necessarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 27, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">intimus, proximus, familiarissimus quisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiarissimus meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiarissimi ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17655.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to one's own people</hi> or <hi rend="ital">country</hi> (cf. domesticus); only in the lang. of the haruspices, of <hi rend="ital">those parts of the animal which related to the party that sacrificed</hi> (opp. hostilis): <cit><quote lang="la">(haruspices) fissum familiare et vitale tractant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:13:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Decio caput jecinoris a familiari parte caesum haruspex dicitur ostendisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mater procurans familiare ostentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17655.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Familiar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">customary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habitual</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi familiare est omnes cogitationes meas tecum communicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 24, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiare est hominibus omnia sibi ignoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:30:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuisse statuariam artem familiarem Italiae quoque indicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 16, § 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:49" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 7, 31, § 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17655.9" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adapted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae peregrina ... transferuntur, minus sunt familiaria nostro solo quam vernacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiarissimum hoc platanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 57, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hipposelinum sabulosis familiarissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 48, § 163</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fămĭlĭārĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> * </sense><sense id="n17655.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">By families</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros in montibus Romani acceperunt familiariter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Colon. p. 119" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Colon. p. 119</bibl></cit> Goes.—</sense><sense id="n17655.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Familiarly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on friendly terms</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hominem ignotum compellare familiariter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium familiariter Me attrectas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil turpius quam cum eo bellum gerere, quicum familiariter vixeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiariter amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amatum a me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 19, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: nosse causas, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be familiarly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intimately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurately acquainted with</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:7" default="NO">5, 7, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ex longinquo petitur, parum familiariter nostro solo venit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>suitable</tr>, <tr>adapted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentius, liberius, familiarius cum domina vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 23, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>;
