<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:7:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 7, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Verre familiarissime et amicissime vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 9, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
familiaritas: <entryFree id="n17656" type="main" key="fa^mi^li^a_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămĭlĭārĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>familiaris, II. B. I.</etym>, <sense id="n17656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">familiarity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">familiar intercourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimate acquaintance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17656.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (freq. and class.; in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: amicitia, necessitudo, notitia): familiaritas tanta nullo cum hospite ... ut nihil sit familiaritate nostra conjunctius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Antipatro Derbete mihi ... summa familiaritas intercedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 73, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum P. Terentio Hispone mihi summa familiaritas consuetudoque est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 65, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri boni ... familiaritate conjuncti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memorabilis C. Laelii et P. Scipionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digna mihi res nostrā familiaritate visa est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: Verginii familiaritate<cb n="FAMU" />  delector, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiaritatem consuetudo affert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alicujus familiaritatem venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in familiaritatem intrare penitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se insinuare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:70:section=169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recipere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ali cujus familiaritatem se applicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versatus in intima familiaritate hominis potentissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:26:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 26, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem familiaritate devincire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudines et familiaritates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inveteratas familiaritates exstinguere (opp.: odia sempiterna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam a sapientium familiaritatibus ad vulgares amicitias oratio nostra delabitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17656.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in <number>plur.</number> concr. for familiares, <hi rend="ital">intimate acquaintances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friends</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes amicitias et familiaritates intra breve tempus afflixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">e praecipua familiaritate Neronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
familiariter: <entryFree id="n17657" type="main" key="fa^mi^li^a_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămĭlĭārĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. familiaris <sense id="n17657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
familiola: <entryFree id="n17658" type="main" key="fa^mi^li^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămĭlĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>familia</etym>, <sense id="n17658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little family</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
famino: <entryFree id="n17659" type="gloss" key="famino"><orth extent="full" lang="la">famino</orth>, <itype>dicito</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:87:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 87, 10</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
famis: <entryFree id="n17660" type="main" key="fa^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. fames <sense id="n17660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
famose: <entryFree id="n17661" type="main" key="fa_mo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāmōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. famosus <sense id="n17661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
famositas: <entryFree id="n17662" type="main" key="fa_mo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāmōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>famosus</etym>, <sense id="n17662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ill fame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignominy</hi> (post-class. and rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
famosus: <entryFree id="n17663" type="main" key="fa_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fama</etym>, <sense id="n17663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">much talked of</hi> (well or ill), i. e. <hi rend="ital">famed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17663.1" n="I" level="1"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">famous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renowned</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">famosae mortis amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors Junii Blaesi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir secundis adversisque juxta famosus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs (Hierosolyma),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:7:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit> Duk.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 267</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa (with pulchra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 13, 11</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 2, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17663.2" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense. </sense><sense id="n17663.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Infamous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notorious</hi> (class.): qui etiam me miserum famosum facit flagitiis suis, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 305, 28</bibl>: me ad famosas vetuit mater accedere, i. e. meretrices, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:68:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 68, 277</bibl>; cf. Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 306, 5</bibl> (Rep. 4, 6 ed. Mos.): <cit><quote lang="la">famosam veneficiis Martinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:12:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 12, 7</bibl>; cf.: et formosus homo fuit et famosus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 305, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">famosa impudensque largitio regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hymen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:134 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 134 al.</bibl></cit>—Esp. law t. t., <hi rend="ital">without reputation</hi>, Cod. 5, 40, 9; cf. infamia.— </sense><sense id="n17663.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, actively, <hi rend="ital">defamatory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slanderous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scandalous</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cognitionem de famosis libellis tractavit,</quote> <trans><tr>libels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delationibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 41</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">libelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de injuriis et libellis famosis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46</bibl></cit>, tit. 10; Cod. Th. 9, 34, 7; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 9, 36, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>a lampoon</tr>, <tr>pasquinade</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epigrammata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 73</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 324</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 15</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fāmōse</orth> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">with fame</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glory</hi> (post-class. and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 20" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 20</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.—Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum famosius curare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
famul: <entryFree id="n17664" type="main" key="fa^mu^l"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭl</orth>, v. 1. famulus <sense id="n17664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
famula: <entryFree id="n17665" type="main" key="fa^mu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 1. famulus, II.</entryFree>
famulabundus: <entryFree id="n17666" type="main" key="fa^mu^la_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭlābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>famulor</etym>, <sense id="n17666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves zealously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
famulanter: <entryFree id="n17667" type="main" key="fa^mu^lanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭlanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n17667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">servilely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slavishly</hi>, etc., v. famulor <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
famularis: <entryFree id="n17668" type="main" key="fa^mu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>famulus</etym>, <sense id="n17668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to servants</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slaves</hi> (rare but class.): vestis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:2:67" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 747" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 747</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of subjugation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hederae,</quote> <trans><tr>the Bacchantes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:268" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 268</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> adverb., <hi rend="ital">servilely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec famulare timens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:40" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
famulatio: <entryFree id="n17669" type="main" key="fa^mu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>famulor</etym>, <sense id="n17669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a body of domestics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">household</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 115, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl>, p. 176, 20.</sense></entryFree>
famulatorius: <entryFree id="n17670" type="main" key="fa^mu^la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">servile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slavish</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mendicitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Anim. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Fid. 5, 5, 58</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭlā-tōrĭe</orth>, <hi rend="ital">slavishly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Amic. 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
famulatrix: <entryFree id="n17671" type="main" key="fa^mu^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a female servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handmaid</hi> (postclass.):<pb n="725" /> <cb n="FANA" />  penna, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 128</bibl>: coquina medicinae famulatrix est, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
famulatus: <entryFree id="n17672" type="main" key="fa^mu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>famulor</etym>, <sense id="n17672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">servitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slavery</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in famulatu esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam miser virtutis famulatus servientis voluptati!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 33, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 991" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 991</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in famulatum subeunte natura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 1, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
famulitas: <entryFree id="n17673" type="main" key="fa^mu^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>famulus</etym>, <sense id="n17673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a serving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servitude</hi> (ante-class.), Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 109, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:ib. 29" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> ib. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
famulitium: <entryFree id="n17674" type="main" key="fa^mu^li^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭlĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (ante- and post-class.). <sense id="n17674.0" n="I" level="1"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">servitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slavery</hi>: famulitium (al. famuletium) dicebatur, quod nunc servitium, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=87:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 87, 3</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n17674.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">the servants</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slaves of a household</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus e famulitio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 804</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sever. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 179, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 285, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
famulo: <entryFree id="n17675" type="main" key="fa^mu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to use as a servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make serviceable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">elementa ipsa (Christus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
famulor: <entryFree id="n17676" type="main" key="fa^mu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n17676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to be a servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to serve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wait upon.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17676.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (rare but class.): cum autem hi famulantur (with alterius esse and opp. sui esse), Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 109, 6</bibl> (Rep. 3, 25 ed. Mai. et Mos.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui jucundo labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famulati Deo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famulantis fistula Phoebi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:58" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fortuna famulante,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 513</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">terra omnibus cruciatur horis, multoque plus, ut deliciis, quam ut alimentis nostris famuletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 63, 63, § 157</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭlan-ter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">servilely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submissively</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 111, 28</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Fragm. p. 218</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
famulus: <entryFree id="n17677" type="main" key="fa^mu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (an archaic form famul, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 110, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1035" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1035</bibl> (al. 1048); for which cf. in the Oscan ‡ famel: famuli origo ab Oscis dependet, apud quos servus famel nominabatur, unde et familia vocata, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=87:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 87, 5</bibl> Müll.), <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n17677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">famulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:57" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:752" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 752</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:20" default="NO">3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:282" default="NO">282</bibl>) <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root dhā, to lay, found; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ti/-qh-mi</foreign>; Osc. faama, house, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 254" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 254</bibl>; cf. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 183</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attendant; a maid - servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handmaid</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17677.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis, qui vi oppressos imperio coërcent, sit sane adhibenda saevitia, ut heris in famulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 24</bibl></cit>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=229" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 229</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 157 ed. Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 701</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 79</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Idaeae matris famuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 574</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei alumni (Silenus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus erat infestae famulus vindexque Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 272</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 95</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Actaeon's hounds,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 229</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:41:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 41, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17677.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam famulae longe fugitant furtimque cachinnant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 703</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:81 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 81 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si virtus famula fortunae est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res familiaris, quae est ministra et famula corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 12, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17678" type="main" key="fa^mu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fămŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. famulus</etym>, <sense id="n17678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servile</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not ante-Aug.): aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:286" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:360" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:647" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:749" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 749</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 2, 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 2, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 203</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fanatice: <entryFree id="n17679" type="main" key="fa_na_ti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fānātĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n17679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">enthusiastically</hi>, <hi rend="ital">franticly</hi>, v. fanaticus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fanaticus: <entryFree id="n17680" type="main" key="fa_na_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fānātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. fanum</etym>. <sense id="n17680.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to a temple</hi>: PECVNIA, Inscr. Veron. ap. Bull. Dell' <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1836, p. 141</bibl>; cf. Borghesi, ib.—</sense><sense id="n17680.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Inspired</hi> by a divinity, <hi rend="ital">enthusiastic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17680.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fanaticus, oestro Percussus, Bellona, tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:123" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 123</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so cf the priests of Bellona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2316 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam subeuntibus armatis muros fanatici Galli ... occurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the priests of Cybele,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:112" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 112</bibl></cit>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 1061, cf. also: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli vaticinantes fanatico carmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si servus inter fanaticos non semper caput jactaret, etc. (shortly after: circa fana bacchatus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:1:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 1, § 9</bibl></cit>: fanatica dicitur arbor fulmine <cb n="FARC" /> icta, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=92:19" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 92, 19</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n17680.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">frantic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">isti philosophi superstitiosi et paene fanatici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:57:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 57, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactatio corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">error,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:19:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 19, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">jactare id (caput) et comas excutientem rotare, fanaticum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 71</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fānātĭce</orth>, <hi rend="ital">franticly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">madly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">absonis ululatibus constrepentes fanatice pervolant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 214, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fandus: <entryFree id="n17681" type="main" key="fandus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fandus</orth>, <sense id="n17681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gerund.;</hi> v. for.</sense></entryFree>
fanester: <entryFree id="n17682" type="main" key="Fanester"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fanester</orth>, <itype>tris</itype>, e; v. 2. fanum.</entryFree>
fanitalis: <entryFree id="n17683" type="gloss" key="fa_ni^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fānĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. fanum</etym>, <sense id="n17683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a temple</hi>, Inscr. Guarin. Comment. XII. p. 28.</sense></entryFree>
fannius: <entryFree id="n17684" type="main" key="Fanni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fannĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n17684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman gens</hi>: 1. C. Fannius Strabo, <hi rend="ital">son-in-law of Laelius</hi>, introduced as a speaker by Cicero in de Rep. and Lael.; 2. <hi rend="ital">His son of the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was consul</hi> A. U.C. 632, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:99 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 26, 99 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 183</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>. C. Fannius, <hi rend="ital">an historian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Pliny the younger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:5:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 5, 1 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17684.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n17684.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fannĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Fannius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Fannian</hi>: lex, <hi rend="ital">a sumptuary law introduced by the consul</hi> C. Fannius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17684.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fannĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">conturbat me epitome Bruti Fanniana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 5, 3</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: charta, <hi rend="ital">manufactured in the establishment of</hi> Q. Rhemnius Fannius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 24</bibl>, §§ 75, 78.</sense></entryFree>
fano: <entryFree id="n17685" type="hapax" key="fa_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fanum</etym>, <sense id="n17685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dedicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consecrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sacrificio quodam fanatur, id est ut fani lege sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fanulum: <entryFree id="n17686" type="gloss" key="fa_nu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fānŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small temple</hi>, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=103:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 103, 7</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
fanum: <entryFree id="n17687" type="main" key="fa_num1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fari; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 54</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=88:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 88, 1</bibl>, and 93, 17 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 41, 90</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n17687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place dedicated to some deity by forms of consecration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sanctuary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temple</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">templum, aedes, delubrum, cella, sacellum, sacrarium): in ea pugna Jovis Statoris aedem votam, ut Romulus ante voverat: sed fa num tantum, id est locus templo effatus, sacratus fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eamque unam ob causam Xerxes inflammari Atheniensium fana jussisse dicitur, quod deos inclusos parietibus contineri nefas esse duceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro patriis fanis atque delubris propugnandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aris ac focis, de fanis ac templis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fana templaque expilavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter fani religionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fanum antiquissimum et sanctissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:20:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 20, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dianae Ephesi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:20:section=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 20, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hammonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:848" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 848</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eumenidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 9, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17688" type="main" key="Fanum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fanum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n17688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Adriatic Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a celebrated temple of Fortuna</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Fano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Fanum Fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 83</bibl> and 84; <cit><quote lang="la">and Colonia Fanestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1535</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3143</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3969</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
far: <entryFree id="n17689" type="main" key="far"><orth extent="full" lang="la">far</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">farris</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>akin with frico, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n17689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of grain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spelt</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ze/a</foreign>, Triticum spelta, Linn. </sense><sense id="n17689.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">the earliest food of the Romans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">both roasted and ground into meal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:63" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:2:6" default="NO">1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 8, 19, § 81</bibl> sqq.; 18, 30, 72, § 298; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:131 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 131 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adoreum, i. q. far,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>, freq. for <hi rend="ital">corn</hi> in general, <hi rend="ital">grain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flava farra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 73</bibl></cit> (opp. legumen); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 101</bibl>; 219; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:693" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 693</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 519 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n17689.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">coarse meal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grits</hi>, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:45" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 143 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 87 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pium, i. e. mola salsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 23, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">salsa farra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:284" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 284</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">used in nuptials,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 140</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">far caninum,</quote> <trans><tr>coarse bread for dogs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
farcimen: <entryFree id="n17690" type="main" key="farci_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farcīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>farcio</etym>, <sense id="n17690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sausage</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">a fartura farcimina in extis appellata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=111" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 111</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 229</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
farciminosus: <entryFree id="n17691" type="main" key="farci_mi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farcīmĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>farciminum</etym>, <sense id="n17691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a disease called</hi> <cb n="FARI" /> farciminum: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
farciminum: <entryFree id="n17692" type="main" key="farci_mi^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farcīmĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>farcio</etym>, <sense id="n17692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disease in horses and other animals</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">costiveness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
farcino: <entryFree id="n17693" type="main" key="farci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farcĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stuff;</hi> trop. (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fandis tacenda farcinat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>mixes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 998</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
farcio: <entryFree id="n17694" type="main" key="farci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farcĭo</orth>, <itype>farsi, fartum, sometimes farctum</itype> (post-class. form farsum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:8" default="NO">8, 8</bibl>; <sense id="n17694.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">and farcītum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Litt. 22</bibl></cit>), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">frak-, fra/ssw</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to shut in;</hi> cf. Lat. frequens; Germ. Berg, Burg</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cram</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill full</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17694.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17694.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvinus perlucidus Melitensi rosa fartus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medios parietes farcire fractis caementis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 51, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustelae ventriculus coriandro fartus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 16, § 60</bibl></cit>: Jovis satelles jecore opimo farta et satiata, etc., Cic. Poët. Tusc. 2, 10, 24; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">edaces et se ultra quam capiunt farcientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17694.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to fatten</hi> an animal, = saginare: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinas et anseres sic farcito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 7, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17694.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n17694.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to fill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cram</hi> with any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">fartum totum theatrum,</quote> <trans><tr>filled</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 353, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infinitis vectigalibus (rex) erat fartus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 28, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17694.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To stuff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cram into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in os farciri pannos imperavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum lignum in gulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 70 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ischaemon in nares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 45, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc farta premitur angulo Ceres omni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>copious</tr>, <tr>abundant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fartum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">farctum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">stuffing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestina et fartum eorum, cum id animal nullo cibo vivat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 29, § 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 21:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 21, 2</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">pulpa fici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 10</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">viaticum,</quote> <trans><tr>a filling for the journey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 45</bibl></cit>, acc. to Ritschl.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">fartum vestis, i. q. corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 8</bibl>, read stragem, v. Ritschl ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
farctus: <entryFree id="n17695" type="main" key="farctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>; v. farcio.</entryFree>
faredo: <entryFree id="n17696" type="main" key="fare_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n17696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of abscess</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 3, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
farfarus: <entryFree id="n17697" type="main" key="farfa^rus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farfărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n17697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant colt's-foot</hi>, called also farfugium and chamaeleuce: tussilago, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 85, § 135</bibl>.— Also in the form <orth extent="full" lang="la">farfĕrus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 1, 32</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=88:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 88, 13</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n17698" type="main" key="Farfa^rus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Farfărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Fabaris.</entryFree>
farferus: <entryFree id="n17699" type="main" key="farfe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farfĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. 1. farfarus.</entryFree>
farfugium: <entryFree id="n17700" type="main" key="farfugium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farfugium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 1. farfarus.</entryFree>
farina: <entryFree id="n17701" type="main" key="fa^ri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fărīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>far</etym>, <sense id="n17701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ground corn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flour.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17701.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 9, 20, § 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:137" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 67, § 137</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">facis farinam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>waste</tr>, <tr>scatter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:16:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 16, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 13, 33</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n17701.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the <hi rend="ital">dust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">powder</hi> of other substances resembling meal: <cit><quote lang="la">folia myrti siccantur in farinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 9, 81, § 162</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gypsum resolvitur in farinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 24, 59, § 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minium tunditur in farinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 119</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cornus cervini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tofi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 20, 34, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7, 26, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caminorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17701.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, to designate the <hi rend="ital">material</hi> of which a thing is composed, i. e. <hi rend="ital">its nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quality</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum fueris nostrae farinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:115" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassius quidam Parmensis quadam epistola ut pistoris nepotem sic taxat Augustum: Materna tibi farina ex crudissimo Ariciae pistrino, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
farinaceus: <entryFree id="n17702" type="gloss" key="fa^ri_na_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fărīnācĕus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">a)leurw/dhs</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
farinarium: <entryFree id="n17703" type="gloss" key="fa^ri_na_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fărīnārĭum</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">a)leurw/n</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
farinarius: <entryFree id="n17704" type="main" key="fa^ri_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fărīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>farina</etym>, <sense id="n17704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to meal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meal-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cribrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 76, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
farinosus: <entryFree id="n17705" type="hapax" key="fa^ri_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fărīnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of meal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mealy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">congeries,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
farinula: <entryFree id="n17706" type="main" key="fa^ri_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fărīnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little meal</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Reg. 1, 17, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
farinulentus: <entryFree id="n17707" type="hapax" key="fa^ri_nu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fărīnŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mealy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fario: <entryFree id="n17708" type="main" key="fa^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fărĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n17708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a salmon-trout</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 130</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
farior: <entryFree id="n17709" type="gloss" key="fa_ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fārĭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n17709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [for], <hi rend="ital">to speak</hi>: NI TESTIMONIVM FARIATVR, Fragm. XII. Tab ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> <pb n="726" /> <cb n="FAS" /></sense></entryFree>
faris: <entryFree id="n17710" type="main" key="fa_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fāris</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fātur</orth>, etc., v. for.</entryFree>
farneus: <entryFree id="n17711" type="main" key="farne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>farnus</etym>, <sense id="n17711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the ashtree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fungi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:13" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 13</bibl></cit> (al. faginei).</sense></entryFree>
farnus: <entryFree id="n17712" type="main" key="farnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. for franus, contr. from fraxinus</etym>, <sense id="n17712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ash-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl> dub. (al. fraxinus); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
farraceus: <entryFree id="n17713" type="main" key="farra_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farrācĕus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>far</etym>, <sense id="n17713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of spelt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 7, 22, § 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
farrago: <entryFree id="n17714" type="main" key="farra_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farrāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mixed fodder for cattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mash.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17714.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: farrago appellatur id, quod ex pluribus satis pabuli causa datur jumentis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=91:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 91, 14</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 41, § 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 205</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 283</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17714.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n17714.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A medley</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hodge-podge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri libelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:86" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17714.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A trifle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:77" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
farrarius: <entryFree id="n17715" type="main" key="farra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to spelt</hi>, and in gen. <hi rend="ital">to corn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grain.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17715.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <trans><tr>a sort of hand-mill for corn</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 23, § 97</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17715.2" n="II" level="1"> In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">farrārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a granary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hay-loft</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
farratus: <entryFree id="n17716" type="main" key="farra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n17716.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Filled with corn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">olla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:31" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17716.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Made of corn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <trans><tr>preparations of meal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:109" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
farrearius: <entryFree id="n17717" type="hapax" key="farre^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farrĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to grain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
farreatio: <entryFree id="n17718" type="main" key="farre^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farrĕātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the use of speltbread in marrying</hi> (for the more usu. confarreatio, q. v.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 374</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
farreatus: <entryFree id="n17719" type="main" key="farre^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farrĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, adj. [id.], <sense id="n17719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made with the use of spelt-bread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiae (i. e. confarreatio),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
farreus: <entryFree id="n17720" type="main" key="farre^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of spelt</hi>, or in gen. <hi rend="ital">of corn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">far. vel triticeus panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: spicum, <hi rend="ital">an ear of corn</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=280:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 280, 9</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n17720.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">farrĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. libum), <hi rend="ital">a speltcake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
farriculum: <entryFree id="n17721" type="main" key="farri^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farrĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>farreum</etym>, <sense id="n17721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small spelt-cake</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 21 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
farsilis: <entryFree id="n17722" type="main" key="farsi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farsĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>farcio</etym>, <sense id="n17722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crammed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fattened</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. fartilis.</sense></entryFree>
farsura: <entryFree id="n17723" type="main" key="farsu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fattening</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 1</bibl> (al. assura); <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 27</bibl>; cf. fartura.</sense></entryFree>
farsus: <entryFree id="n17724" type="main" key="farsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">farsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from farcio.</entryFree>
farticula: <entryFree id="n17725" type="hapax" key="farti^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fartĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>fartum</etym>, <sense id="n17725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little stuffing</hi>, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 331, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fartilis: <entryFree id="n17726" type="main" key="farti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fartĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>farcio</etym>, <sense id="n17726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stuffed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crammed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17726.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">anseres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 22, 27, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 187, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17726.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fartilia,</quote> <trans><tr>stuffing</tr>, <tr>mixture</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fartim: <entryFree id="n17727" type="main" key="fartim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fartim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by stuffing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cramming;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">closely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">densely</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tectum omne fartim stipaverant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 130, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">isicium fartim concisum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cut up fine as if for stuffing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 117, 30.</sense></entryFree>
fartor: <entryFree id="n17728" type="main" key="fartor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fartor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n17728.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stuffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fattener of fowls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poulterer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguem quoque facere gallinam quamquam fartoris non rustici sit officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 580, 15</bibl>; Inscr. Rein. cl. 9, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 12: <cit><quote lang="la">cuppedinarii omnes, cetarii, lanii, coqui, fartores, piscatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">minimeque artes eae probandae quae ministrae sunt voluptatum, cetarii, lanii, coqui, fartores, piscatores, ut ait Terentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum scurris fartor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 229</bibl></cit> (v. Dillenb. ad loc.).—</sense><sense id="n17728.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sausagemaker</hi> (only once in the doubtful passage): <cit><quote lang="la">de nostro saepe edunt, quod fartores faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit> (dub.; Spengel, qui custodem oblectant).—</sense><sense id="n17728.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: fartores nomenclatores, qui clam velut infercirent nomina salutatorum in aurem candidati, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=88:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 88, 15</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fartori nomenclatori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Placid.</author> p. 464</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fartum: <entryFree id="n17729" type="main" key="fartum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fartum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. farcio <sense id="n17729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fartura: <entryFree id="n17730" type="main" key="fartu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fartūra</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">farctūra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>farcio</etym>. <sense id="n17730.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cramming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fattening</hi> of fowls, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:8:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7" default="NO">8, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n17730.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The filling up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rubble</hi>, of a wall, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
fartus: <entryFree id="n17731" type="main" key="fartus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fartus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from farcio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17732" type="hapax" key="fartus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fartus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">farctus</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>farcio</etym>, <sense id="n17732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stuffing</hi>, for the usual fartum (v. farcio <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 231</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fas: <entryFree id="n17733" type="main" key="fas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fas</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root fa-, cf. for; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fhmi/, fa/-nai</foreign></etym> <sense id="n17733.0" n="I" level="1"> Orig. belonging to the relig. <cb n="FASC" /> lang., <hi rend="ital">the dictates of religion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divine law;</hi> opp. to jus, or human law (rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: aequitas, justitia): jus ac fas omne delere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">festis quaedam exercere diebus Fas et jura sinunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra fas, contra auspicia, contra omnes divinas atque humanas religiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13, § 34</bibl></cit>.—Personified: <cit><quote lang="la">audi Juppiter, audite Fines, audiat Fas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima deum Fas quae Themis est Graiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Technop. Idyll. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fas omne mundi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Here. Fur. 658" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Here. Fur. 658</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17733.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17733.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A court-day</hi>, i. q. fastus (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dies qui vocatur sic: QVANDO REX COMITIAVIT, FAS,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6</bibl></cit>, §§ 31, 32.—</sense><sense id="n17733.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen. (<hi rend="ital">justice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equity</hi>, but usu. to be translated as an adjective), <hi rend="ital">right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allowable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lawful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permitted;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">possible</hi> (the predominant meaning of the word in prose and poetry; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in the phrase fas est, with a subjectclause): fas, justum, pium, aequum subjici possunt honestati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fas atque nefas exiguo fine libidinum Discernunt avidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 585</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe ubi fas versum atque nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 505</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:87" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jusque fasque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si jus, si fas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut fas jusque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eum nihil delectaret, quod aut per naturam fas esset aut per leges liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 16, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad fas esset, quoad liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">huic legi nec obrogari fas est, neque derogari ex hac aliquid licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me fas est orare etiam abs te, pater, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid non adeptus est, quod homini fas esset optare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si eos hoc nomine appellari fas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 37, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non esse fas, Germanos superare, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque fas esse existimant, ea litteris mandare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quos (libellos) interim respicere fas sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut si aliter facere fas non sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:36" default="NO">8, 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:9" default="NO">10, 2, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 7, 1: nec scire fas est omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fas omne est, Cytherea, meis te fidere regnis,</quote> <trans><tr>there is every reason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:800" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 800</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc fas est dictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque id me facere fas existimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fas habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leporem et gallinam et anserem gustare fas non putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
