G. 5, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 23</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fas prohibet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:205" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra quam fas erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridetque (deus), si mortalis ultra Fas trepidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fas omne abrumpit,</quote> <trans><tr>every right</tr>, <tr>obligation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et foedera respicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium quoque jus et sacra legationis et fas gentium rupistis,</quote> <trans><tr>the law of nations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 42</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in Tac. freq. = jus: patriae,</quote> <trans><tr>the right</tr>, <tr>claim of one's native land</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 19 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
fasceatim: <entryFree id="n17734" type="main" key="fasce^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fascĕātim</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fascĕŏla</orth>, v. fasci-.</entryFree>
fascelis: <entryFree id="n17735" type="main" key="Fasce_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fascēlis</orth>, v. Facelīnus.</entryFree>
fascia: <entryFree id="n17736" type="main" key="fasci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fascĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fa/scea</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindred with fascis</etym>, <sense id="n17736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bandage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swathe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">girth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fillet.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17736.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (to bind up diseased parts of the body; to wrap round the feet to prevent the boots from rubbing them; to bind under the breasts of women; a headband set with pearls, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: redimiculum, vitta, infula, diadema): devinctus erat fasciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:217" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 60, 217</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 3, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fasciis crura vestiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:144" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 144</bibl></cit>: cum vincirentur pedes fasciis, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 537, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 3, 1</bibl> (cf. with <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2, 7</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 57, 82, § 221</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 25</bibl> (with pedules); <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 40 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnem praependentem fascia substringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brachio lanis fasciisque obvoluto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflatum circa fascia pectus eat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 274</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:134" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides illum Scythiae regem, insigni capitis decorum? si vis illum aestimare, fasciam solve: multum mali sub illa latet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 80" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 80 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">a diadem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puero fasciis opus est, cunis, incunabulis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>swaddling-cloths</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somniasse se, ovum pendere ex fascia lecti sui cubicularis,</quote> <trans><tr>a bed-girth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:65:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 65, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:62:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 62, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:159" default="NO">14, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas sole siccatas junci fasciis involvit,</quote> <trans><tr>bands of rushes</tr>, <tr>mats</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 17, 18, § 66</bibl></cit>: nitor, qualem Bruttia praestabat <cb n="FASC" /> calidi tibi fascia visci, <hi rend="ital">plaster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:14" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 14</bibl>.— Prov.: non es nostrae fasciae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of our rank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17736.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n17736.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The casing of a door</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 451, 20</bibl>; and 86, 10.—* </sense><sense id="n17736.4" n="B" level="2"> In archit., <hi rend="ital">a wreath round a pillar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a listel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n17736.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A streak of cloud in the sky</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil color hic caeli, nil fascia nigra minatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:294" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 294</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17736.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A zone</hi> of the earth: <cit><quote lang="la">orbi terrae in quinque zonas, sive melius fascias dico, discernitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, §§ 602, 607.</sense></entryFree>
fasciatim: <entryFree id="n17737" type="gloss" key="fasci^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fascĭātim</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ĕātim</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>fascis</etym>, <sense id="n17737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in bundles</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 20</bibl>, one of a class of adverbs which some grammarians improperly regard as a distinct part of speech.</sense></entryFree>
fascicularia: <entryFree id="n17738" type="hapax" key="fasci^cu^la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fascĭcŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fasciculus</etym>, <sense id="n17738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">things carried in bundles</hi> (as wood, hay, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
fasciculus: <entryFree id="n17739" type="main" key="fasci^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fascĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>fascis</etym>, <sense id="n17739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bundle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">packet</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">epistolarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of packets of letters,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">librorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasciculum ad nares admovebis?</quote> <trans><tr>a bunch of flowers</tr>, <tr>nosegay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linum in fasciculos manuales colligatum siccatur in sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 13, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fasciger: <entryFree id="n17740" type="hapax" key="fasci^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fascĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fascis-gero</etym>, <sense id="n17740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing the fasces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the consulship</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 321</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fascina: <entryFree id="n17741" type="hapax" key="fasci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fascīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fascis</etym>, <sense id="n17741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bundle of sticks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fagot</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fascinatio: <entryFree id="n17742" type="main" key="fasci^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fascĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fascino</etym>, <sense id="n17742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enchanting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bewitching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witchcraft</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:101" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8, 27, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 4, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fascinator: <entryFree id="n17743" type="gloss" key="fasci^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fascĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enchanter</hi>, Primas. in Ep. ad Galat. c. 3: fascinator, <foreign lang="greek">ba/skanos</foreign>, Gloss. Vet.</sense></entryFree>
fascinatorius: <entryFree id="n17744" type="hapax" key="fasci^na_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fascĭnātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to enchantment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">witchcraft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 7, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fascino: <entryFree id="n17745" type="main" key="fasci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fascĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ba/skanos, baskai/nw</foreign>, v. fascinum</etym>, <sense id="n17745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to enchant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bewitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fascinate</hi> by the eyes or the tongue: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quis teneros oculus mihi fascinat agnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malā linguā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra fascinantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal fascinatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 7, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos non obedire veritati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Galat. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fascinosus: <entryFree id="n17746" type="hapax" key="fasci^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fascĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fascinum</etym>, <sense id="n17746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with a large</hi> fascinum: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta fascinosior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 79 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
fascinum: <entryFree id="n17747" type="main" key="fasci^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fascĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>) [quasi bascanum, <foreign lang="greek">ba/skanon</foreign>, Cloat. Ver. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 12, 4</bibl>; but cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=88:16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 88, 16</bibl>]. <sense id="n17747.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bewitching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witchcraft</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 62, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17747.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17747.2" n="A" level="2"> I. q. membrum virile (because an image of it was hung round the necks of children as a preventive against witchcraft; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=97" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 97</bibl> Müll.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:18" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 138</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 176</bibl>.—Also in the form fascinus, i. <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 5, 20</bibl>; and personified, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fascĭnus</orth>, <itype>i, as a deity</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the Phallus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17747.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sea-shell</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 297, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fascio: <entryFree id="n17748" type="main" key="fasci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fascĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n17748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fascia</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to envelop with bands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swathe</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fasciato trunco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:57:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 57, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:30:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 30, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fasciola: <entryFree id="n17749" type="main" key="fasci^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fascĭŏla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fascĕ_</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bandage for the legs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=130" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 255</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 21, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fascis: <entryFree id="n17750" type="main" key="fascis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fascis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">fa/kelos</foreign>, fascia, but v fido</etym>, <sense id="n17750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bundle</hi> of wood, twigs, straw, reeds, etc. </sense><sense id="n17750.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fagot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fascine; a packet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parcel.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17750.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fasces stramentorum ac virgultorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:15:6" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno comites in fasce libelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:107" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot crimina, tot reos uno velut fasce complecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of a crowd of people, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:24:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 24, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17750.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">load</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanus in armis Injusto sub fasce viam cum carpit,</quote> <trans><tr>i. e. soldiers' baggage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 347</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 26</bibl> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">(apes) saepe ultro animam sub fasce dedēre,</quote> <trans><tr>under the burden</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego hoc te fasce levabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 9, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venales humero fasces portare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 80</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17750.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in <number>plur.</number> fasces, <hi rend="ital">a bundle carried before the highest magistrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and consisting of rods and an axe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with which</hi> <pb n="727" /> <cb n="FAST" /> <hi rend="ital">criminals were scourged and beheaded.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17750.5" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">lictores duo, duo viminei fasces virgarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sibi (Tullo Hostilio) duodecim lictores cum fascibus anteire liceret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anteibant lictores cum fascibus duobus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces praetoribus praeferuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:9:section=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 9, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Publicola statim secures de fascibus demi jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: tum demissi populo fasces, <hi rend="ital">lowered</hi> (as a mark of respect) <hi rend="ital">before the people</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40, 62</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Valerius fasces primus demitti jussit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: (P. Valerius) summissis fascibus in contionem escendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">under B.: paulo ante dimissi fasces,</quote> <trans><tr>surrendered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:61:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 61, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecedebant incompta signa, versi fasces, at the funeral of Germanicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque in litteris, neque in fascibus insignia laureae praetulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:71:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 71, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">visus C. Marius cum fascibus laureatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 28, 59</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">laureati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatorii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17750.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a high office</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">the consulship</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">qui petere a populo fasces saevasque secures Imbibit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1009" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1009</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum non populi fasces, non purpura regum Flexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si Detulerit fasces indigno, detrahet idem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et titulis et fascibus olim Major habebatur donandi gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:110" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:152" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 152</bibl>.—Of royalty: <cit><quote lang="la">diadema Quirini Et fasces meruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:260" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 260</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17750.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to give place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to acknowledge one's inferiority</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tibi aetas nostra jam cederet fascesque summitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 6, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
faselaria: <entryFree id="n17751" type="main" key="fa^se_la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făsēlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, v. phaselaria.</entryFree>
faselus: <entryFree id="n17752" type="main" key="fa^se_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făsēlus</orth>, <itype>faseolus</itype>, v. phas-.</entryFree>
fasianus: <entryFree id="n17753" type="main" key="fasi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fasĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. phas-.</entryFree>
fassus: <entryFree id="n17754" type="main" key="fassus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fassus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from fateor.</entryFree>
fasti: <entryFree id="n17755" type="main" key="fasti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fasti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. 1. fastus.</entryFree>
fastidibilis: <entryFree id="n17756" type="main" key="fasti_di^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīdĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fastidio</etym>; <sense id="n17756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nauseous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loathsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreeable</hi> (postclass. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">judicia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
fastidienter: <entryFree id="n17757" type="main" key="fasti_di^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīdĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n17757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disdainfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scornfully;</hi> v. fastidio <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fastidiliter: <entryFree id="n17758" type="hapax" key="fasti_di^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīdĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>fastidio</etym>, <sense id="n17758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with disgust</hi>: Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 112, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fastidio: <entryFree id="n17759" type="main" key="fasti_di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīdĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n17759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [fastidium], <hi rend="ital">to feel disgust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loathing</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">nausea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shrink</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flinch</hi> from any thing unpleasant to the taste, smell, hearing, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to loathe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dislike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despise</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; cf.: taedet, reprobo, reicio, respuo, repudio). </sense><sense id="n17759.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17759.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bi bendum hercle hoc est, ne nega: quid hic fastidis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fastidientis stomachi est multa degustare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majus infundam tibi Fastidienti poculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:78" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fastidis!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17759.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (perh. not till the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">num esuriens fastidis omnia praeter Pavonem rhombumque?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmentarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cactos in cibis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 57, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvialem lupum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: vinum, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">euphorbiae sucus fastidiendum odorem habet,</quote> <trans><tr>disgusting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 38, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures ... redundantia ac nimia fastidiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:116" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 116</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17759.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of mental aversion, <hi rend="ital">to be disdainful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scornful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haughty; to disdain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorn.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17759.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fastidit gloriosus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide ut fastidit simia!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in recte factis saepe fastidiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 16, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17759.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (like taedet): <cit><quote lang="la">fastidit mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>; so, mei, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 496, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 18" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17759.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (perh. not before the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n17759.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(populus) nisi quae terris semota suisque Temporibus defuncta videt, fastidit et odit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilice silvarum et agelli, Quem tu fastidis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus et rivos apertos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc lucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammatices elementa tamquam parva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:31:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 31, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes duces post Alexandrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominationibus aliis fastiditus (i. e. a prioribus principibus despectus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quae dicendo refutare non possumus, quasi fastidiendo calcemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oluscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 80</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of inanim. or abstr. subjects: te cum fastidierit popina dives, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:44:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 44, 10</bibl></cit>: <cb n="FAST" /> somnus agrestium Lenis virorum non humiles domos Fastidit umbrosamve ripam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 23</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudatus abunde, Non fastiditus si tibi, lector, ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:7:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 7, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem non fastiditis annumerare viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetulus bos, ab ingrato jam fastiditus aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:270" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 270</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: res ardua vetustis novitatem dare ... fastiditis gratiam, etc., Plin. H. N. praef. § 15.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. fut. pass.</hi> with supine: <cit><quote lang="la">quia (verba) dictu fastidienda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:13:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17759.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a me fastidit amari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocorum legere fastidis genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastidit praestare hanc inferioribus curam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastidit balsamum alibi nasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 32, 59, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an creditis, aequo animo iis servire, quorum reges esse fastidiant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 16</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne fastidieris nos in sacerdotum numerum accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs coepit fastidire, munus vulgatum a civibus isse in socios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 41, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 39</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n17759.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīdĭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">disdainfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scornfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentibus fastidienter appellatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 166, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17759.11" n="2" level="3"> <mood>Part.</mood>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīdītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in act. signif., <hi rend="ital">disdaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despising</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne me putes studia fastiditum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fastidiose: <entryFree id="n17760" type="main" key="fasti_di^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīdĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fastidiosus <sense id="n17760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fastidiosus: <entryFree id="n17761" type="main" key="fasti_di^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīdĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fastidium</etym>, <sense id="n17761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of disgust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aversion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17761.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that feels disgust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squeamish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disdainful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scornful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fastidious</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17761.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaccae fastidiosae fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurium sensus fastidiosissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 23, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ille fastidiosus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 18</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17761.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis fastidiosus aedilis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in superiores contumax, in aequos et pares fastidiosus, in inferiores crudelis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 40, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hac infinita licentia haec summa cogitur, ut ita fastidiosae, mollesque mentes evadant civium, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonius facilis in causis recipiendis erat, fastidiosior Crassus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:57:207" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 57, 207</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Memmius perfectus Iitteris, sed Graecis: fastidiosus sane Latinarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 70, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominus terrae Fastidiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestimator,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that rates altogether too high</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastidiosissimum mancipium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>excessively haughty</tr>, <tr>proud</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est res difficilis, ardua, fastidiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 17, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17761.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that creates disgust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgusting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loathsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreeable</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): fastidiosam desere copiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastidiosā tristis aegrimoniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 73</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīdĭōse</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">squeamishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scornfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disdainfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fastidiously</hi> (freq. in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. very rare): huic ego jam stomachans fastidiose, Immo ex Sicilia, inquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 258</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diligenter et prope fastidiose judicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lente ac fastidiose probare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recipior in coetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3</bibl></cit> prol. 23: <cit><quote lang="la">venditare aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastidiosius ad hoc genus sermonis accedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:89:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 89, 364</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fastiditas: <entryFree id="n17762" type="main" key="fasti_di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, i. q. fastidium, <sense id="n17762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a loathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aversion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
fastiditus: <entryFree id="n17763" type="main" key="fasti_di_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīdītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from fastidio.</entryFree>
fastidium: <entryFree id="n17764" type="main" key="fasti_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīdĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. 2. fastus</etym>, <sense id="n17764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a loathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aversion</hi> for any thing, esp. for any sort of enjoyment (very freq. and class.; cf. taedium, nausea, etc.). </sense><sense id="n17764.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">nausea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squeamishness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distaste</hi> for food: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi satietas et fastidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:17:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 17, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel fastidium creat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 50, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastidium abigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 9, 81, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 38, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 27, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 74, § 155</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna movet stomacho fastidia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:184" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:41 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 25, § 41 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n17764.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp. of a spoiled, pampered taste, <hi rend="ital">niceness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daintiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delicacy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 18</bibl>: tantum in illis esse fastidium; <cit><quote lang="la">ut nollent attingere nisi eodem die captum piscem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:16:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 16, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17764.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to sight: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum in hominum insolentium indignitate fastidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17764.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dislike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aversion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fastidiousness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17764.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliqua re celerrime fastidio quodam et satietate abalienari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: si (eloquentia) et ex copia satietatem<cb n="FAST" />  et ex amplitudine fastidium tulerit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescis quantum interdum afferat hominibus fastidii, quantum satietatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satiari fastidio similitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla voluptas est, quae non assiduitate fastidium pariat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 40, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitato assiduitatis fastidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudem esse omnino in nostris poëtis, aut inertissimae segnitiae est, aut fastidii delicatissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae habent ad res certas vitiosam offensionem atque fastidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:10:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolens domesticarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis stultitia laborat fastidio sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec id fit fastidio meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sit fastidio Graecos sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 1, 1, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum lignum in fastidio est,</quote> <trans><tr>is despised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid fastidio damnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: non omnia (i. e. arbores) in omnibus locis nasci docuimus, nec translata vivere: hoc alias fastidio evenit, <hi rend="ital">fastidious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">delicate nature</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 32, 58, § 134</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam ea, quae recta essent, probari, quam quae prava sunt, fastidiis adhaerescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 258</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatoris fastidia ferre superbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opem ferre poëtis antiquis contra fastidia nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matri longa decem tulerunt fastidia menses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17764.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (with the notion of fastus predominating), <hi rend="ital">scornful contempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haughtiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pride</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">elatio, vanitas, arrogantia, superbia, fastus): ex eorum (divitiorum) fastidio et superbia (regna) nata esse commemorant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 32</bibl></cit> Mos. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">superbiam magno opere, fastidium arrogantiamque fugiamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 7, 20</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">superbia et fastidio amplissimos honores repudiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:55:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 55, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si essent arrogantes, non possem ferre fastidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Phil. 10:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">efferri fastidio et contumaciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">superba pati fastidia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oderunt fastidia divi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:69" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tulerit Meroes fastidia longa superbae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> E. 11, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteris fastidia quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:184" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 184</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fastigate: <entryFree id="n17765" type="main" key="fasti_ga_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīgātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fastigo <sense id="n17765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fastigatio: <entryFree id="n17766" type="main" key="fasti_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fastigo</etym>, <sense id="n17766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sharpening to a point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pointing</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut fastigatio laevi descendat cuneo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, 364</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fastigatus: <entryFree id="n17767" type="main" key="fasti_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <sense id="n17767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi>, from fastigo.</sense></entryFree>
fastigium: <entryFree id="n17768" type="main" key="fasti_gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. Sanscr. bhrshtīs, corner, rim; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/-flaston</foreign>, aplustria, the ornamented stern of a ship; O. H. Germ. brort, the prow</etym>, <sense id="n17768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the top of a gable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gable end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pediment</hi> (syn.: cacumen, culmen, vertex, apex). </sense><sense id="n17768.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolii fastigium illud et ceterarum aedium non venustas, sed necessitas ipsa fabricata est ... utilitatem templi fastigii dignitas consecuta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:46:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 46, 180</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fastigia aliquot templorum a culminibus abrupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evado ad summi fastigia culminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 458</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4, § 14</bibl>.—Hence, meton., <hi rend="ital">the roof of a house</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 491</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 568</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:235" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 235</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere pulvinar, simulacrum, fastigium, flaminem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:Phil. 2:43:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 43, 110</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same: omnes unum in principem congesti honores: circa templa imagines ... suggestus in curia, fastigium in domo, mensis in caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae signa eorum sunt in Palatina aede Apollinis in fastigio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 12, 43, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">operi tamquam fastigium imponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:7:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 7, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17768.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17768.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The extreme part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extremity</hi> of a thing, whether above or below. </sense><sense id="n17768.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles ... pari altitudinis fastigio oppidum cingebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:69:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 69, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus nondum aquae fastigium aequabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summi operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque agger aequaverat summae fastigia terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquatilium ova rotunda, reliqua fere fastigio acuminata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 52, 74, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gracilitas (arundinis) nodis distincta leni fastigio tenuatur in cacumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 158</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua in leve fastigium exacuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:141" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 33, 60, § 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:18:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 18, 24</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:827" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 827</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:553" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontis fastigium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the height on which the fountain sprang up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:41:5" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 41, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17768.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The lower part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depth</hi>: forsitan et scrobibus quae sint fastigia, quaeres, <pb n="728" /> <cb n="FAST" /> <hi rend="ital">what should be the depth of the trenches</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 288</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17768.6" n="2" level="3"> (From the sloping form of the gable.) <hi rend="ital">A slope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declivity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab oppido declivis locus tenui fastigio vergebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 45, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum paulo leniore fastigio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquum loci ad declivitatem fastigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:85:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 85, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes leniore submissa fastigio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capreoli molli fastigio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">musculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrobes paulatim angustiore ad infimum fastigio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>gradually narrowing from top to bottom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 73, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si (fossa) fastigium habet, ut (aqua) exeat e fundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17768.7" n="3" level="3"> In the later grammarians, <hi rend="ital">an accent</hi> placed over a word, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 264</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">§ 268 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 428</bibl> P.</sense><sense id="n17768.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17768.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The highest part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the highest degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most exalted rank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dignity</hi> (perh. only since the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid numinum hanc Romani imperii molem in amplissimum terrarum orbis fastigium extulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:131:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 131, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic fit, ut dei summum inter homines fastigium servent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:52:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quoad usque ad memoriam nostram tribuniciis consularibusque certatum viribus est, dictaturae semper altius fastigium fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in consulare fastigium vehi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 69, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad regium fastigium evehere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii cives ejusdem fastigii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stare in fastigio eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetoricen in tam sublime fastigium sine arte venisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et poësis ab Homero et Vergilio tantum fastigium accepit, et eloquentia a Demosthene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magice in tantum fastigii adolevit, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>grew into such esteem</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17768.10" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">dignity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(M. Laetorio) curatio altior fastigio suo data est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ampliora etiam humano fastigio decerni sibi passus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam mortale fastigium egressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus super humanum fastigium elatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quales ex humili magna ad fastigia rerum extollit Fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:39" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17768.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A leading</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chief point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head</hi> in a discourse; <hi rend="ital">a principal sort</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kind</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">summa sequar fastigia rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 342</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e quibus tribus fastigiis (agrorum) simplicibus,</quote> <trans><tr>sorts</tr>, <tr>kinds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter haec tria fastigia formae discrimina quaedam fiunt sationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec atque hujuscemodi tria fastigia agri, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: quo fastigio sit fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> (and v. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 223</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">laudem relego fastigia summa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Laud. Anast. 148</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fastigo: <entryFree id="n17769" type="main" key="fasti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>v. fastigium</etym>, <sense id="n17769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make pointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sharpen to a point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring to a point</hi> (in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> only post-Aug., not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n17769.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta verno tempore fastigantur in stipulam,</quote> <trans><tr>grow up into a straw with a sharpened point</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia in exilitatem fastigantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 19, 118, § 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(terra) spatiosa modice paulatim se ipsa fastigat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se molliter (Africa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:10:5" default="NO">3, 10, 5</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutis super capita densatis, stantibus primis, secundis summissioribus ... fastigatam, sicut tecta aedificiorum sunt, testudinem faciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis in modum metae in acutum cacumen a fundo satis lato fastigatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastigatus in mucronem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastigatā longitudine (margaritarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 113</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17769.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17769.3" n="1" level="3"> (Cf. fastigium, I. B. 2.) Fastigatus, <hi rend="ital">sloping up to a point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sloped; sloping down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descending</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis leniter fastigatus paulatim ad planitiem redibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna ... prona ac fastigata, ut secundum naturam fluminis procumberent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17769.4" n="2" level="3"> (Cf. I. B. 3.) In the later grammarians, <hi rend="ital">to mark with an accent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to accent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fastigetur, longa brevisve fuat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 262</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17769.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to elevate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exalt</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui statum celsitudinis tuae titulorum parilitate fastigat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam diademate crinem Fastigatus eas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exalted</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad arcem fastigatissimae felicitatis evectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2</bibl></cit>. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">duo fastigatissimi consulares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fastīgāte</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 10, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fastosus: <entryFree id="n17770" type="main" key="fasto_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. fastus</etym>, <sense id="n17770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of</hi> <cb n="FATA" /> <hi rend="ital">pride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haughty</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">moecha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:13:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est, fastose?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 131</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">domus, Auct. Pan. ad Pis. 107: garum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:102:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 102, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fastuosus: <entryFree id="n17771" type="main" key="fastu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, collat. form of fastosus, q. v., <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 578</bibl>.</entryFree>
fastus: <entryFree id="n17772" type="main" key="fastus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. root <foreign lang="greek">*f*a, fa/skw, fhmi/</foreign>, fari; lit., in which it is allowed to speak</etym>, fasti dies; and more commonly <sense id="n17772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fasti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (acc. to the 4th decl. <case>acc.</case> fastus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 711</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. An. 14:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. An. 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 4</bibl> Bentley (dub.); <case>abl.</case> fastibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 187</bibl>), a publicists' t. t., <hi rend="ital">a day on which judgment could be pronounced. on which courts could be held</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a court-day</hi> (opp. nefasti, v. nefastus; cf. also: feriae, justitium, otium). </sense><sense id="n17772.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (dies) nefastus erit, per quem tria verba (DO, DICO, ADDICO) silentur: Fastus erit, per quem lege licebit agi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:4:section=29 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 4, § 29 sq.</bibl> Müll. The register of these legal court-days, which for a long time existed only in the archives of the pontifices, was kept from the knowledge of the people, until Cn. Flavius, scribe to the Pontifex Maximus Appius Caecus, posted up a copy in the Forum: <cit><quote lang="la">posset agi lege necne, pauci quondam sciebant, fastos enim volgo non habebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 11, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cn. Flavius) fastos circa forum in albo proposuit, ut, quando lege agi posset, sciretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17772.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17772.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an enumeration of all the days of the year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with their festivals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magistrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">events</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">a calendar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">almanac</hi> (syn.: annales, historia, res gestae, narratio, fabula): fastorum libri appellantur, in quibus totius anni fit descriptio: fasti enim dies festi sunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=87:19" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 87, 19</bibl> Mull. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo ipse annalium mediocriter nos retinet quasi enumeratione fastorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum diem festum ludorum de fastis suis sustulissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:67:section=151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 67, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastos correxit (Caesar),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omne tempus ... ita in fastos referretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 100</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17772.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n17772.5" n="1" level="3"> The Fasti consulares, or <hi rend="ital">registers of the higher magistrates</hi>, according to their years of service (v. Orelli, Onomast. Tullian. P. III.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae (tempora) semel Notis condita fastis Inclusit volucris dies (i. e. fastis consularibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per titulos memoresque fastos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">memores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora si fastosque velis evolvere mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui redit in fastos et virtutem aestimat annis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in codicillorum fastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paginas in annalibus magistratuum fastisque percurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex fastis evellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos consules fasti ulli ferre possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 13, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17772.6" n="2" level="3"> Fasti Praenestini a Verrio Flacco ordinati et marmoreo parieti incisi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> II. p. 379 sq.</bibl>, and the authors there cited; v. also Anthon's Dict. of Antiq. p. 432 sq.—</sense><sense id="n17772.7" n="3" level="3"> Fasti, <hi rend="ital">the title of a poem of Ovid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Roman festivals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the festival-calendar;</hi> which, however, he completed for but six months of the year.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17773" type="main" key="fastus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n17773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> fasti, Coripp. 4, 137), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. dharshati, to be bold; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qrasu/s, qa/rsos</foreign>; full form farstus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">scornful contempt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disdain</hi> of others, <hi rend="ital">haughtiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrogance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pride</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and in post-Aug. prose; syn.: fastidium, clatio, superbia, arrogantia, insolentia). </sense><sense id="n17773.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu cave nostra tuo contemnas carmina fastu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fastus inest pulchris sequiturque superbia formam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:419" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbo simul ac procaci fastu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspice primum, Quanto cum fastu, quanto molimine circum Spectemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto te in fastu negas, amice,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>thou withdrawest thyself with so much pride from my society</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastus erga patrias epulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17773.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastus superbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 25, 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:75" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:762" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 762</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17774" type="main" key="fastu_s3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fastūs</orth>, <itype>uum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n17774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">calendar;</hi> v. 1. fastus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fatalis: <entryFree id="n17775" type="main" key="fa_ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fātālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fatum</etym>, <sense id="n17775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordained by fate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">destiny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decreed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatal</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17775.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: illa fatalis necessitas, quam <foreign lang="greek">ei(marme/nhn</foreign> dicitis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.
