D. 1, 20, 55</bibl>: fatalis et immutabilis<cb n="FATE" />  continuatio ordinis sempiterni, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam fatalem conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divina aique fatalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 21, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus ad salutem rei publicae prope fatalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic annus fatalis ad interitum hujus urbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:53" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4851</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 452</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">deae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Fates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 8, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Sibylline</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:79 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 79 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:257" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex, i. e. fatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 316</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 203</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora fluminis,</quote> <trans><tr>destined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: mala. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <trans><tr>a natural death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mors fato propera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> fatale est, with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam fatale est, medicum adhibere, quam convalescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi fatale esset, non posse Gallias debellari nisi a se consule,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 43</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17775.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">dangerous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destructive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deadly</hi> (perh. only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">vincla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:876" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 876</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:919" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 919</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus (Etruscorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:400" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:411" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:381" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">DIES,</quote> <trans><tr>dying-day</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3023</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4758</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid mihi fatale contigerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fātālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">according to fate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatally</hi>: omnia, quae fiunt quaeque futura sunt, ex omni aeternitate definita dicis esse fataliter, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mori,</quote> <trans><tr>to die a natural death</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fatalitas: <entryFree id="n17776" type="main" key="fa_ta_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fātālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fatalis</etym>, <sense id="n17776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fatal necessity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatality</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 66, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fataliter: <entryFree id="n17777" type="main" key="fa_ta_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fātālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fatalis <sense id="n17777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fatantur: <entryFree id="n17778" type="gloss" key="fatantur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fatantur</orth>, v. fator.</entryFree>
fateor: <entryFree id="n17779" type="main" key="fa^te^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fătĕor</orth>, <itype>fassus, 2</itype> (archaic <sense id="n17779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. praes.</hi> faterier, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 148</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [from the root <foreign lang="greek">*f*a, fa/w</foreign>, fari], <hi rend="ital">to confess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acknowledge.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17779.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (freq. and class.; syn.: confiteor, profiteor); construed for the most part with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">object;</hi> rarely with the <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17779.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si verum mihi eritis fassae, vinclis exsolvemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">verum fateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut verius fatear,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Grat. Act. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fatebor?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi in tormentis mori maluerunt falsum fatendo quam infitiando dolere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatum, culpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:315" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 315</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 634</bibl></cit> et saep.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">fatetur facinus, si quis judicium fugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:174" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 174</bibl></cit> Rib.—</sense><sense id="n17779.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fateor atque etiam profiteor et prae me fero, te, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me despexe ad te per impluvium tuum, Fateor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fateor eam esse importunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis contra rem publicam se amici causa fecisse fateatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: qui se debere fateantur, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se Cicero ab illis plurimum fateatur adjutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fateor me duci ventre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura inventa metu injusti fateare necesse est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum igitur causa eas rerum copias comparatas fatendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ellips.</hi> of <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fateor peccavisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non didici sane nescire fateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 418</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">two acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se servum fateatur tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum (i. e. Jovem) ipsi lapides hominem fatebuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fassus hujus se spectaculi debitorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17779.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de facto turpi aliquo aut inutili aut utroque fateatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:26:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 26, 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17779.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita libenter confitetur, ut non solum fateri, sed etiam profiteri videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Est tibi nomen Menaechmo? <hi rend="ital">M.</hi> Fateor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leno sum, fateor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non potest sine malo fateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui a Naevio vel sumpsisti multa, si fateris, vel, si negas, surripuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 19, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulline faterier audes?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fatendo lenis et summissa (vox),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fatendum impulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">da veniam fasso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; parenthetically:<pb n="729" /> <cb n="FATI" />  fateor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4</bibl>. 4, 16: <cit><quote lang="la">fatebor enim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:362 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 362 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17779.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17779.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to discover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi> (rare; not in Cic.): Laterensis nostri et fidem et animum singularem in rem publicam semper fatebor, <hi rend="ital">bear witness to</hi>, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocentem fuisse patrem fatetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:37" default="NO">1, 10, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utque sedet vultu fassus Telamonius iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:525" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 525</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patinarum calore pisces vitalem motum fateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 57, 83, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors sola fatetur, Quantula sint hominum corpuscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:172" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 172</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:132" default="NO">15, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">properabo fateri, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Belus amnis non nisi refuso mari harenas fatetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 65, § 190</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17779.8" n="B" level="2"> In gram. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">fatendi modus,</quote> <trans><tr>the indicative</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:5:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, 5, 8</bibl>.!*? </sense><sense id="n17779.9" n="1" level="3"> In <hi rend="ital">pass. signif.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc (agrum) excipere nominatim, qui publicus esse fateatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 21, 57</bibl></cit> (dub.).—</sense><sense id="n17779.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgo fatebatur, utique minorem eum legasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:39:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 39, § 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
faticanus: <entryFree id="n17780" type="hapax" key="fa_ti^ca^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fātĭcănus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fatum-cano</etym>, <sense id="n17780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">announcing fate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 418</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
faticinus: <entryFree id="n17781" type="hapax" key="fa_ti^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fātĭcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">announcing fate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 436</bibl></cit>; cf. the preced. art.</sense></entryFree>
fatidicus: <entryFree id="n17782" type="main" key="fa_ti^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fātĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fatum-dico</etym>, <sense id="n17782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that predicts future events</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetic</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui futura praedivinando soleant fari, fatidici dicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 52</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 340</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 348</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Themis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:321" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Apollo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:262" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 36, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 43, 43, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 93, 95, § 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Sibylline</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:304" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 304</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fātĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a prophet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fatifer: <entryFree id="n17783" type="main" key="fa_ti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fātĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fatum-fero</etym>, <sense id="n17783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that brings death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death-dealing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deadly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destructive</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sonat unā fatifer arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 621</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 492</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:251" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mavors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 3, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fatigabilis: <entryFree id="n17784" type="main" key="fa^ti_ga_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fătīgābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fatigo</etym>, <sense id="n17784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be wearied</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fatigatio: <entryFree id="n17785" type="main" key="fa^ti_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fătīgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">weariness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatigue</hi> (stronger than lassitudo; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>; perh. not ante-Aug.; but defatigatio in Cic. and Caes.). </sense><sense id="n17785.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitationis finis esse debet lassitudo, quae citra fatigationem est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum atque hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deficiens dolore et fatigatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:173" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudor et fatigatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 147</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with sudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:11" default="NO">1, 12, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">requiescit labor ille, cujus sibi ipsa fatigatio obstabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17785.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">jeer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banter</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum in auditorio vel levi fatigatione taxaverunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sever. Dial. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17785.3" n="III" level="1"> Concr.: <cit><quote lang="la">fatigationi consulitur,</quote> <trans><tr>the wearied</tr>, <tr>fatigued</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fatigatorius: <entryFree id="n17786" type="main" key="fa^ti_ga_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fătīgātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fatigo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n17786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">jeering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bantering</hi>, = facetus (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">verba erant dulcia, jocosa, fatigatoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fatigo: <entryFree id="n17787" type="main" key="fa^ti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fătīgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xa/tis</foreign>, want, <foreign lang="greek">xati/zw</foreign>; cf.: adfatim, fatiscere, fessus</etym>, <sense id="n17787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatigue; to vex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harass</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; but defatigare is freq. in Cic. and Caes.). </sense><sense id="n17787.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17787.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 491</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">defessos. (nervos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentem in dente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:827" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 827</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (anser) celer pennā tardos aetate fatigat Eluditque diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:687" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe etiam cursu quatiunt (armenta) et sole fatigant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per triennium Romanos exercitus fatigaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:34:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 34, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos nulla fatigant Proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquamdiu pugna atroci cum semet ipsi fatigassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextram osculis,</quote> <trans><tr>to load with kisses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitu vicina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 573</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">venatu invigilant pueri silvasque fatigant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lolium tribulique fatigant Triticeas messes,</quote> <trans><tr>disturb</tr>, <tr>mar</tr>, <tr>hinder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 485</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17787.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verberibus, tormentis, igni fatigati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:20:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 20, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(sicarii) sunt vinclis et carcere fatigandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:18:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 18, 73</bibl></cit>; and: (milites) magno aestu fatigati, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:95:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 95, 1</bibl>: Romani multo ante <cb n="FATI" /> labore proeliisque fatigati, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 76, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque insomniis, neque labore fatigari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum ex magna parte legisset, fatigatus Tiberio tradidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga demeret Bobus fatigatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludo fatigatumque somno Puerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Daedalus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 260</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17787.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17787.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to weary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatigue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">importune; to plague</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vex.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17787.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">punire aliquem aut verbis fatigare,</quote> <trans><tr>to reprove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prece qua fatigent Virgines sanctae Vestam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum per aliquot dies fatigassent singulos precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:45:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 45, 10</bibl></cit> Drak.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Galba fatigabat deos (sc. precibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corripit e somno corpus sociosque fatigat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socios voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:192" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discentem per ambages fatigabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:826" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 826</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">die noctuque fatigare animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 70:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 70, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundae res sapientium animos fatigant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 11, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: quid aeternis minorem Consiliis animum fatigas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera Juno, Quae mare nunc terrasque metu caelumque fatigat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama terras fatigat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:120" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olli remigio noctemque diemque fatigant,</quote> <trans><tr>wear out</tr>, <tr>pass</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem noctemque Marte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:602" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 602</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 11, 81: <cit><quote lang="la">curasque ita corde fatigat,</quote> <trans><tr>keeps revolving</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:496" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 496</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:675" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 675</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra niti neque aliud se fatigando nisi odium quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 3, 3</bibl></cit> Kritz. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Metellus) Marium fatigantem de profectione domum dimittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 73:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 73, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mea de fraude deos fatigas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20, 3</bibl></cit> (3, 13, 3 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">quos ego audio maxima ope niti, ambire, fatigare vos singulos, ne quid, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17787.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolis fatigari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vagenses fatigati regis suppliciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 66, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">denique saepius fatigatus lenitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 111:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 111, 3</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">uti aetati concederet, fatigatus a fratre, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 4</bibl></cit> Kritz.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hersilia precibus raptarum fatigata orat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 36, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis fatigatur auditor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa cogitatione suscepti muneris fatigor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> pracf. § <cit><quote lang="la">7: si dicendum apud fatigatos est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:1" default="NO">1, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:14" default="NO">10, 5, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17787.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in late Lat. </sense><sense id="n17787.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To vex with raillery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to jeer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sever. Dial. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17787.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To exhaust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intoxicate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatigati a vino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fatilegus: <entryFree id="n17788" type="hapax" key="fa_ti^le^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fātĭlĕgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fatum-lego</etym>, <sense id="n17788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gathering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">collecting death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">toxica fatilegi carpunt matura Sabaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:821" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 821</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fatiloquium: <entryFree id="n17789" type="hapax" key="fa_ti^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fātĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fatiloquus</etym>, <sense id="n17789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prophecy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sibyllae fatiloquia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 46, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fatiloquus: <entryFree id="n17790" type="main" key="fa_ti^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fātĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fatum-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n17790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">declaring fate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetic;</hi> hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prophet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prophetess</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Carmenta mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cretensis Epimenides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 352</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fatim: <entryFree id="n17791" type="gloss" key="fa^tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fătim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n17791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sufficiently;</hi> acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 123</bibl>, from ‡ fatis, whence affatim and fatigo.</sense></entryFree>
fatisco: <entryFree id="n17792" type="main" key="fa^tisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fătisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (ante-class. in the <sense id="n17792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form <orth extent="full" lang="la">fătiscor</orth>, ci; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>) [cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xa/tis, xatizw</foreign>; Lat. fatigo, fessus, adfatim; for the f = <foreign lang="greek">x</foreign>, cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xu, xe/w, xeu/sw</foreign>; Lat. fundo, fons], <hi rend="ital">to open in chinks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clefts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gape</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crack open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumble to pieces</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n17792.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(naves) laxis laterum compagibus omnes Accipiunt inimicum imbrem rimisque fatiscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxis solida aera fatiscunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 809</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">area neu pulvere victa fatiscat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pinguis tellus) haud umquam manibus jactata fatiscit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera flammis (with torreri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu canimus frustra, nec verbis victa fatiscit Janua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:67" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 67</bibl></cit> (Müll. patescit): <cit><quote lang="la">camelo ungues in longiore itinere sine calceatu fatiscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 105, § 254</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17792.2" n="(b)" level="5"> In the <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">non delubra deum simulacraque fessa fatisci?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 308</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17792.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become exhausted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to droop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decrease</hi> (ante-class. in the <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form): <cit><quote lang="la">solum segetibus fatiscit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:13:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrofa celerrime fatiscit, quae plures educat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse exercitusque per inopiam et labores fatiscebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 24</bibl></cit>: scriptores dum copia fatiscunt, id. <cb n="FATU" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri in segnitiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:395" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibusque nesciis fatiscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec fatisceret seditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 10</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsatiata fatiscet Mater Achilleis hiemes affringere bustis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:35" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17792.4" n="(b)" level="5"> In the <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">aevo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 458</bibl></cit>: altera irā, altera vulneribus fatiscuntur, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 479, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:ib. 307:12" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> ib. 307, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 10" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 10</bibl> and 479, 10 and 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Princ. Hist. p. 318" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Princ. Hist. p. 318</bibl> ed. Mai.</sense></entryFree>
fator: <entryFree id="n17793" type="gloss" key="fa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fātor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n17793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a. freq.</hi> [for] only: fatantur, multa fantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=88:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 88, 11</bibl> Müll.: fatatus, <foreign lang="greek">ei(marme/nos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; cf. ib.: fator, <foreign lang="greek">poluloge/w</foreign>, v. ‡ fatantur.</sense></entryFree>
fatua: <entryFree id="n17794" type="main" key="fa^tua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fătua</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 1. and 2. fatuus.</entryFree>
fatue: <entryFree id="n17795" type="main" key="fa^tue_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fătuē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. fatuus <sense id="n17795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fatuellus: <entryFree id="n17796" type="main" key="Fatuellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fatuellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. 2. Fatuus.</entryFree>
fatuina: <entryFree id="n17797" type="main" key="fa^tu^i^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fătŭĭna rŏsa</orth>, <sense id="n17797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for the</hi> paeonia, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fatuitas: <entryFree id="n17798" type="main" key="fa^tu^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fătŭĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. fatuus</etym>, <sense id="n17798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foolishness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">folly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatuity</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:32:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 32, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 25, 2</bibl>; Firm. Math. 8, 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 16, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Ep. 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fatum: <entryFree id="n17799" type="main" key="fa_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n17799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> fatus malus meus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 42, 77</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for II. A.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">that which is said</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an utterance.</hi>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n17799.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a prophetic declaration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oracle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prediction</hi> (rare but class.): neque me Apollo fatis fandis dementem invitam ciet, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl> (Trag. v. 80 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Lentulum sibi confirmasse ex fatis Sibyllinis haruspicumque responsis se, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo fatis quae Veientes scripta haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatis, ominibus oraculisque portendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siculisne resideret arvis Oblitus factorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 703</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17799.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17799.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">that which is ordained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fate;</hi> the <foreign lang="greek">ei(marme/nh</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">moi=ra</foreign> of the Greeks (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna, fors, sors, casus): nec ii, qui dicunt immutabilia esse, quae futura sint nec posse verum futurum convertere in falsum, fati necessitatem confirmant, sed verborum vim interpretantur. At qui introducunt causarum seriem sempiternam, ii mentem hominis voluntate libera spoliatam necessitate fati devinciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:20 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 9, 20 sq.</bibl></cit>; hence the philosophic use of the word to denote <hi rend="ital">the eternal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immutable law of nature</hi>: fieri omnia fato, ratio cogit fateri. Fatum autem id appello, quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">ei(marme/nhn</foreign>, id est ordinem seriemque causarum, cum causa causae nexa rem ex se gignat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:55:125 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 55, 125 sq.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vos fato fieri dicatis omnia, quod autem semper ex omni aeternitate verum fuerit, id esse fatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; and: cum duae sententiae fuissent veterum philosophorum, una eorum, qui censerent omnia ita fato fieri, ut id fatum vim necessitatis afferret; <cit><quote lang="la">in qua sententia Democritus, Heraclitus, Empedocles, Aristoteles fuit: altera eorum, quibus viderentur sine ullo fato esse animorum motus voluntarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:17:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 17, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: ex hoc genere causarum ex aeternitate pendentium fatum a Stoicis nectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:15:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 15, 59</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">anile sane et plenum superstitionis fati nomen ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Daphitae fatum fuit ex equo cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 28</bibl>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque si fatum fuerat, effugisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut praedici posset, quid cuique eventurum et quo quisque fato natus esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">quonam meo fato fieri dicam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: qua quidem in re singulari sum fato, <hi rend="ital">I experience a remarkable fate</hi>, Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid mihi humanitus accidisset multa autem impendere videntur praeter naturam etiam praeterque fatum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>beyond the natural and appointed course of events</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi debita sibi fato dominatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persuasio, cuncta fato agi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi dii immortales omni ratione placati suo numine prope fata ipsa flexissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orte Saturno, tibi cura magni Caesaris fatis data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (Caesare) nihil majus meliusve terris Fata donavere bonique divi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. Sec. 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut caneret fera Nereus Fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">acerba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebeium in circo positum est fatum,</quote> <trans><tr>the fate of the vulgar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:588" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 588</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata regunt homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:63" default="NO">12, 63</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui hoc fato natus est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit hoc sive meum sive rei publicae fatum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:26:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 26, 58</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: eo <pb n="730" /> <cb n="FATU" /> fato se in iis terris collocatam esse arbitratur, ne, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 16, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17799.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n17799.5" n="1" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">the will</hi> or <hi rend="ital">determination of the gods</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu stirpem invisam et fatis contraria nostris Fata Phrygum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 293</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 50</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 455, 25</bibl>.—And also of <hi rend="ital">that which determines the fate</hi> of a person or thing: Ilio tria fuisse audivi fata, quae illi forent exitio: signum ex arce si perisset; <cit><quote lang="la">alterum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 29</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Herculis sagittae, quae fatum Trojae fuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">fata viam invenient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 395</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 113</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Fāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, personified as deities, <hi rend="ital">the Fates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:7:51" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 7, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:259" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 5, 1, 259</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1771 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17799.6" n="2. a." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Bad fortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill fate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calamity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mishap</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum facete et contumeliose in Metellos antiquum Naevii est: Fato Metelli Romae fiunt consules,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pseudo</author> Ascon. ad Cic. Verr. 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit> (p. 140 ed. Orell.); <cit><quote lang="la">and, alluding to this verse: hoc Verrem dicere aiebant, te (sc. Metellum) non fato, ut ceteros ex vestra familia, sed opera sua consulem factum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ego confido impendere fatum aliquod et poenas jamdiu improbitati, nequitiae ... debitas instare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitii ac fati dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abditi in tabernaculis aut suum fatum querebantur aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si jam (quod dii omen avertant) fatum extremum rei publicae venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illo paene fato rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:57:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 57, 145</bibl></cit>.— So, </sense><sense id="n17799.7" n="b" level="4"> Esp. freq. of <hi rend="ital">death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic Hortensii vox exstincta fato suo est, nostra publico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:328" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 96, 328</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite hunc maturius exstingui vulnere vestro quam suo fato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 32, 79</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omen fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nec fato merita nec morte peribat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 696</bibl></cit>: ferro, non fato moerus Argivum (i. e. Achilles) occidit, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 10</bibl> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">perfunctos jam fato = mortuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">qui fato sunt functi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fato cedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 13</bibl></cit>: fato concessit, Pl. Pan. 11, 3; for which: concedere in fatum, Modestin. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:3:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 3, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fato obiit,</quote> <trans><tr>died a natural death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fato fungi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 12</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (uxorem) functam fato respondet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me praeceperit fatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 33</bibl>.—In this sense sometimes in the <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamdudum peccas, si mea fata petis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 118</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Minotauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea fata,</quote> <trans><tr>my ashes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentiet vivus eam, quae post fata praestari magis solet, venerationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:17:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me fata intercepissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> 1; cf.: (mater) acerbissimis rapta fatis, id. § 4; cf. the <hi rend="ital">shades</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spirits of the dead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fato jacentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17799.8" n="3" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">one who brings calamity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plague</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo illa rei publicae paene fata, Gabinium et Pisonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:43:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 43, 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fatuor: <entryFree id="n17800" type="hapax" key="fa^tu^or1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fătŭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n17800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [1. fatuus], <hi rend="ital">to talk foolishly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">desine fatuari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apocol. 7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apocol. 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17801" type="hapax" key="fa_tu^or2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fātŭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n17801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [2. fatuus], <hi rend="ital">to be inspired</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fauno fuit uxor nomine Fatua, quae assidue divino spiritu impleta velut per furorem futura praemonebat: unde adhuc qui inspirari solent, fatuari dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:1:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 443</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fatus: <entryFree id="n17802" type="main" key="fa_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from for.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17803" type="main" key="fa_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>for</etym>. <sense id="n17803.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saying</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 802</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17803.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">an oracle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prophecy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deliaco fatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficta fatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinis fatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17803.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerto fatu fortunae aliorsum prorupit eventus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 42, 77 al.</bibl>; v. fatum, II. A.</sense></entryFree>
fatuus: <entryFree id="n17804" type="main" key="fa^tu^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fătŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root fa, cf. for; properly, garrulous</etym>, <sense id="n17804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simple</hi> (class.; syn.: stultus, stolidus, insipiens, desipiens, stupidus, hebes, ineptus, insulsus, absurdus). </sense><sense id="n17804.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: ego me ipsum stultum existimo, fatuum esse non opinor, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10, 246</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulti, stolidi. fatui, fungi, bardi, blenni, buccones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatuus est, insulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo nequam et improbus, sed etiam fatuus et amens es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 99</bibl></cit>: homo, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 274</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi plane fatui sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17804.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf. </sense><sense id="n17804.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Insipid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tasteless</hi>, of food: ut <cb n="FAUC" /> sapiant fatuae, fabrorum prandia, betae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17804.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Awkward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clumsy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwieldy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa bipennem Insulsam et fatuam dextra tenebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:658" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 658</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17804.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fătŭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">fătŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simpleton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a jester</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buffoon.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17804.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">one who acts foolishly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene ecfregisti, fatue, foribus cardines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:83:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 83, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:8" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17804.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp., kept by Romans of rank for their amusement: <cit><quote lang="la">Harpasten, uxoris meae fatuam, scis hereditarium onus in domo mea remansisse ... si quando fatuo delectari volo, me rideo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 50:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 50, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Comm. 4, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fătŭe</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">foolishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absurdly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerumque studio loquendi fatue modo accedendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 8</bibl></cit> dub. (Spald. and Zumpt, fatui); <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Pat. 6</bibl>. —Hence,</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17805" type="main" key="Fa_tu^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fātŭus</orth>, i. <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n17805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for the prophesying</hi> Faunus; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fātŭ-ellus</orth>; while <hi rend="ital">his sister</hi>, Fauna, <hi rend="ital">who prophesied to females</hi>, was also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fātŭa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fātŭella</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 22, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 83, § 117</bibl> (dub.; Jan. fatuos).</sense></entryFree>
fauces: <entryFree id="n17806" type="main" key="fauces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fauces</orth>, <itype>ium</itype> (<sense id="n17806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sing. nom.</hi> faux only in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:11:127" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 11, 127</bibl>, =arteria aspera; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=78" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 78</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 72</bibl> P. —The <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> fauce sometimes in poets: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 738</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:37:6 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 37, 6 al.</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. Sanscr. bhūka, hole, opening</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the upper part of the throat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from the root of the tongue to the entrance of the gullet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the pharynx</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gullet</hi> (syn.: gula, guttur, jugulum). </sense><sense id="n17806.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: summum gulae fauces vocantur, extremum stomachus; <cit><quote lang="la">quibus fauces non sunt, ne stomachus quidem est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 68, § 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigua in arteria sub ipsis faucibus lingula est, quae, cum spiramus, attollitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>: (galli) favent faucibus russis cantu, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 26, 57</bibl> (Trag. v. 250 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">sitis fauces tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitis fauces urit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lippiunt fauces fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces tussientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 25, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces videntur fauces exasperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 74, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces tumentes strangulant vocem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmatis faucibus, praeconis voce concionatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 84 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propino tibi salutem plenis faucibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merum ingurgitare faucibus plenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exscrea usque ex penitis faucibus,</quote> <trans><tr>from the bottom of your throat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui fauces prehendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sacerdoti scelestus fauces interpresserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueo innectere fauces,</quote> <trans><tr>to strangle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 378</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: ad necem secandasque novacula fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces manu sua oppressit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retinens singulos et contortis faucibus convertens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 62</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">faucibus teneor,</quote> <trans><tr>I am caught by the throat</tr>, <tr>I feel the knife at my throat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum faucibus premeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Timarchides premit fauces defensionis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:76:section=176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 76, § 176</bibl></cit>: eripite nos ex faucibus eorum, quorum crudelitas, etc., <hi rend="ital">from the jaws</hi>, Crass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:52:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 52, 225</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6, § 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem totius belli ore ac faucibus ereptam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e mediis Orci faucibus ad hunc evasi modum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inexplebiles populi fauces exaruerunt libertatis siti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus fauce improba incitatus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>voracity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17806.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of places: </sense><sense id="n17806.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A narrow way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrow inlet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">outlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an entrance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi> (cf. angustiae): Corinthus posita in angustiis atque in faucibus Graeciae, <hi rend="ital">in the mouth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">entrance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Ciliciae angustissimis faucibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qua fauces erant angustissimae portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 39, 2: Masinissam persecutus in valle arta, faucibus utrimque obsessis, inclusit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 32, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aemilius sedens in faucibus macelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:62:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 62, § 145</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">macelli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per fauces montis ut Aetnae Exspirent ignes,</quote> <trans><tr>the crater</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 630</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cava flumina siccis faucibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altae montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus multis faucibus in Aegyptium mare se evomit,</quote> <trans><tr>through many mouths</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bospori,</quote> <trans><tr>the Dardanelles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="FAUS" /> § 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:127" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fornacem facies, fauces praecipites deorsum facito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 38, 3</bibl></cit>: pictis e faucibus currus emittere, <hi rend="ital">from the barriers</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 89 ed. Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n17806.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The jaws</hi> of the earth, <hi rend="ital">gulf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abyss</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patefactis terrae faucibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
